strings.20001: {}{Armor Traits are effects, good or bad, that are inherent to an armor.}
strings.20011: {}{You recover 0.5 seconds faster from knockouts and knockdowns, and 10% faster from winded, suppression and disoriented effects.}
strings.20021: {}{PERK IS DISABLED, LEGACY DESCRIPTION. This armor has almost no stopping power! You have -2 strength in rolls to avoid knockouts.}
strings.20031: {}{With this armor, you have +2 strength in rolls to avoid knockouts. You are also only knocked back half the normal distance.}
strings.20041: {}{The lightness of the armor allows you to move faster. The lower your current AP, the faster you run, up to 25% faster.}
strings.20051: {}{Any attacks will cost 5% less Action Points while wearing this armor.}
strings.20061: {}{Any attacks will cost 5% more Action Points while wearing this armor.}
strings.20071: {}{Wearing this armor makes you feel like a psychopath! Each time you inflict damage to visible target you receive weapon AP cost reduction equal to 1% per 5% target HP damage inflicted with a cap of 20%. This bonus decays over 10 seconds.}
strings.20081: {}{Wearing armor makes you worry less about stray bullets. Each rank of this trait gives you +2 Charisma for purposes of resisting suppression.}
strings.20091: {}{The bullets flying left and right doesn't even make you flinch. You're in Power Armor, for crying out loud! You get 100% Suppression Resistance.}
strings.20101: {}{With each rank of this Armor Trait, you reload weapons 10% faster than normal.}
strings.20111: {}{Wearing this armor makes you less likely to cripple your arms (+2 endurance to rolls), and more likely to avoid weapon drops (+2 strength for rolls vs weapon drop). The gloves do however make it 10% slower to reload weapons.}
strings.20121: {}{You get 25 less HP healed from First Aid or Doc.}
strings.20131: {}{You get 25 more HP healed from First Aid or Doc.}
strings.20141: {}{Performing FA/Doc is costing you 25 base AP less while wearing this armor. Stacks with Field Medic Perk.}
strings.20151: {}{This armor is bulky. Your extra AP regeneration is lowered (-2 Agility for extra AP regen).}
strings.20161: {}{Each rank of this armor trait makes it harder for your enemies to make critical strikes on you. You get +1 Luck for the purposes of resisting critical strikes.}
strings.20171: {}{Anyone trying to attack you with HtH will be shocked. Literally. Melee attackers lose 10 AP and AP Regen+ for 1 seconds for each hit on this armor.}
strings.20181: {}{How do you even take a piss in that thing? Well protected as you may be, it is a bit difficult to see through that helmet. You get -2 Perception for the purposes of determining sight range.}
strings.20191: {}{This armor functions like an exoskeleton, with powerful servos assisting with every movement. You get +3 strength, and you are able to run with weapons that you could otherwise only walk with. If the reactor core is damaged it may trigger nuclear consequences.}
strings.20201: {}{-4 to critical power roll. Knockbacks and Knockdowns converted to winded. You take twice the amount of bullets from a burst. Huge penalties unless Powered (-4 Agility for extra AP regen).}
strings.20211: {}{Your extra AP regeneration is increased (+2 agility for AP Regen+).}
strings.20221: {}{Each level of trait increases your Sneak value by 10}
strings.20231: {}{When you are attacked you receive Run Speed bonus up to 50% dependant on how low your health is. Effect is decaying over 10 seconds.}
strings.20241: {}{Each time you spend AP on attacks you receive bonus to your Run Speed with max of 33%, decaying over 10 seconds.}
strings.20251: {}{Your armor supports your back while lifting. +25 and the weight of your armor are added to your carry weight.}
strings.22001: {}{Quality Mods are effects that are inerent to a loss of item quality.}
strings.22051: {}{Firing this weapon costs 5% more Action Points than normal.}
strings.23001: {}{Quality Mods are effects that are inerent to a loss of item quality.}
strings.100002: {}{|0xff00ff00 Raw physical strength. Modifies: Starting Hit Points, Healing Rate, Melee Damage, Carry Weight, Throwing range, Bleed Resistance, resistance to knockouts and weapon drops.}
strings.100012: {}{|0xff00ff00 The ability to see, hear, taste and notice unusual things. Modifies: Sight Range, Aimed shots, Base critical chance, Hit chance modifiers and resistance to disorient and blinded.}
strings.100022: {}{|0xff00ff00 Stamina and physical toughness. Modifies: Hit Points gain, Healing Rate, Bleed resistance, Knockout duration and resistance to AP Drain and arm and leg cripples.}
strings.100032: {}{|0xff00ff00 A combination of appearance and discipline. Charisma affects your ability to lead others, but also the extent to which you benefit from being lead. Modifies: suppression resistance and leadership boosts.}
strings.100042: {}{|0xff00ff00 Knowledge, wisdom and the ability to think quickly. A high Intelligence is important for any character. Modifies: skill points per level and Base critical chance.}
strings.100052: {}{|0xff00ff00 Coordination and the ability to move well. Modifies: AP+ regeneration, Armor Class, Bleed Resistance and resistance to knockdowns and armor bypass.}
strings.100062: {}{|0xff00ff00 Fate. Karma. Modifies Base crit chance, aimed crit chance, bleed resistance, armor bypass severity, armor class and critical resistance.}
strings.100072: {}{|0xff00ff00 How much damage your character can take before dying.}
strings.100082: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of actions that the character can take during one combat turn.}
strings.100092: {}{|0xff00ff00 Modifies the chance to hit this particular character.}
strings.100102: {}{|0xff00ff00 The amount of bonus damage your character does in hand-to-hand combat.}
strings.100112: {}{|0xff00ff00 The maximum amount of equipment your character can carry, in pounds.}
strings.100122: {}{|0xff00ff00 The rate at which your character takes damage from bleed. The number shown is the time it takes (in seconds) to convert 50% of your bleed into damage.}
strings.100132: {}{|0xff00ff00 Amount of HP your character will heal each 5 seconds.}
strings.100142: {}{|0xff00ff00 The chance to cause a critical hit in combat is increased by this amount.}
strings.100232: {}{|0xff00ff00 Any damage taken is reduced by this amount. Damage Resistance can be increased by wearing armor.}
strings.100302: {}{|0xff00ff00 The amount of radiation you are exposed to is reduced by this percentage. Radiation Resistance can be modified by the type of armor worn, and anti-radiation chems.}
strings.100312: {}{|0xff00ff00 Reduces poison damage by this amount.}
strings.100762: {}{|0xff00ff00 A measure of how experienced your character is. You earn experience by completing quests, killing creatures and participating in Zone Control.}
strings.100772: {}{|0xff00ff00 When you have enough experience, you move up a level. With higher levels, your skills and maximum hit points improve, and you can learn new perks.}
strings.100782: {}{|0xff00ff00 Use free skill points to increase the level of a skill.  As you get better at a given skill, however, it takes more points to raise that skill.  Mastering a skill can take a lot of time and effort.}
strings.100802: {}{|0xff00ff00 How well known you are to others in Phoenix. Participating in Zone Control makes you more famous.}
strings.102002: {}{|0xff00ff00 The use, care and general knowledge of small firearms - pistols, SMGs and rifles.}
strings.102012: {}{|0xff00ff00 The operation and maintenance of really big guns - miniguns, rocket launchers, flamethrowers and such.}
strings.102022: {}{|0xff00ff00 The care and feeding of energy-based weapons.  How to arm and operate weapons that use laser or plasma technology.}
strings.102032: {}{|0xff00ff00 A combination of martial arts, boxing and other hand-to-hand martial arts. Includes the usage of non-ranged melee weapons such as knives, sledgehammers, spears, clubs and so on.}
strings.102042: {}{|0xff00ff00 The skill of muscle-propelled ranged weapons, such as throwing knives, spears and grenades.}
strings.102052: {}{|0xff00ff00 The skill of finding, removing and planting various types of traps.}
strings.102062: {}{|0xff00ff00 General healing skill.  Used to heal small cuts, abrasions and other minor ills.  In game terms, the use of first aid can heal more hit points over time than just rest.}
strings.102072: {}{|0xff00ff00 The healing of major wounds and crippled limbs.  Without this skill, it will take a much longer period of time to restore crippled limbs to use.}
strings.102082: {}{|0xff00ff00 Quiet movement, and the ability to remain unnoticed. If successful, you will be much harder to locate. You cannot run and sneak at the same time.}
strings.102092: {}{|0xff00ff00 The skill of leading other people in combat situations. A skilled leader will be more aware of the battle field, and can inspire others to perform better than they normally would.}
strings.102102: {}{|0xff00ff00 The skill of convincing others that your position is correct. Makes others more sympathetic towards your cause. Affects merchant prices, quest rewards and reputation.}
strings.102112: {}{|0xff00ff00 Practical knowledge of the outdoors, and the ability to live off the land. The knowledge of plants and animals.}
strings.102122: {}{|0xff00ff00 Physics, chemistry and biology. The ability to create useful chemical compounds, including drugs and explosives. Affects the amount of resources retrieved when disassembling items.}
strings.102132: {}{|0xff00ff00 The application of scientific principles and practical knowledge in order to build and maintain various machines and devices.}
strings.102152: {}{|0xff00ff00 Anything that has to do with digging through junk, debris and wrecks.}
strings.102162: {}{|0xff00ff00 The knowledge and practical skills related to wagering. The skill at cards, dice and other games.}
strings.102172: {}{|0xff00ff00 Practical knowledge of the outdoors, and the ability to live off the land. The knowledge of plants and animals.}
strings.102602: {}{|0xff00ff00 This is the number of player controlled characters you mercilessly slayed for your own amusement. You evil PK, you!}
strings.102612: {}{|0xff00ff00 This line shows the number of male humans you have killed during the course of your adventures.}
strings.102622: {}{|0xff00ff00 This line shows the number of female humans you have killed during the course of your adventures.}
strings.102632: {}{|0xff00ff00 This line shows the number of human children you have killed during the course of your adventures.}
strings.102642: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of Super Mutants you have slain during the course of your adventures.}
strings.102652: {}{|0xff00ff00 This line shows the number of ghoul mutants you have killed during the course of your adventures.}
strings.102662: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of mutated Radscorpions that you have put to death during your adventure.}
strings.102672: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of insectoids that you have exterminated in the wasteland.}
strings.102682: {}{|0xff00ff00 This line shows the total number of dead mantises that you have squashed so far.}
strings.102692: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of vehicles you have destroyed.}
strings.102702: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of pig rats you have slain.}
strings.102712: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of molerats you have killed. They look big but and scary.}
strings.102722: {}{|0xff00ff00 The total number of dogs that you have sent to the great kennel in the sky.}
strings.102732: {}{|0xff00ff00 This line shows the number of Brahmin (mutated cows) you have chopped up during your travels.}
strings.102742: {}{|0xff00ff00 This line shows the number of plants you have weeded out of the world.}
strings.102752: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of cute silver lizards you have wiped off the face of the planet.}
strings.102762: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of golden lizards you have erased from this planet.}
strings.102772: {}{|0xff00ff00 The number of fire spitting lizards you have killed during your journey.}
strings.102782: {}{|0xff00ff00 This is the number of mutant Floaters that you have put to death.}
strings.102792: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your tally of dead mutant Centaurs.}
strings.102802: {}{|0xff00ff00 A count of alien things slain by your hand.}
strings.102812: {}{|0xff00ff00 This line shows that you have slain the Deathclaw, and any of his spawn.}
strings.102822: {}{|0xff00ff00 This is the number of robots that you have destroyed or dismantled.}
strings.102832: {}{|0xff00ff00 This is the total number of beings that would still be alive if it wasn't for you.}
strings.103012: {}{|0xff00ff00 With Awareness, you are given detailed information about any critter you examine.  You see their exact hit points and information about any weapon they are equipped with.}
strings.103022: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have learned the secret arts of the East, or you just punch faster.  In any case, your Hand-to-Hand attacks cost 1 AP less to perform.}
strings.103032: {}{|0xff00ff00 Experience in unarmed combat has given you the edge when it comes to damage.  You cause +2 points of damage with hand-to-hand and melee attacks for each level of this Perk.}
strings.103042: {}{|0xff00ff00 For each level of Bonus Move, you get 2 free APs each turn that can only be used for movement.  In other words, you can move 2 free hexes each turn for each level of this Perk.}
strings.103052: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your training in firearms and other ranged weapons has made you more deadly in ranged combat.  For each level of this Perk, you do +2 points of damage with ranged weapons.}
strings.103062: {}{|0xff00ff00 This Perk allows you to pull the trigger a little faster and still remain as accurate as before.  Each ranged weapon attack costs 1 AP less to perform.}
strings.103072: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are more likely to move before your opponents in combat, since your Sequence is +2 for each level of this Perk.}
strings.103082: {}{|0xff00ff00 With each level of this Perk, you get a +2 bonus to your Healing Rate.  This is in addition to your normal healing rate, thus you heal faster.}
strings.103092: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are more likely to cause critical hits in combat if you have this Perk.  Each level of More Critical gets you an additional +5% chance to cause a critical hit.}
strings.103102: {}{|0xff00ff00 With the Night Vision Perk, you can see in the dark better.  This will reduce the overall darkness level by 20%.}
strings.103112: {}{|0xff00ff00 You command attention by just walking into a room.  The initial reaction of another person is improved by 10% for each level of this Perk.}
strings.103122: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are better able to avoid radiation and the bad effects radiation causes.  Each level of this Perk improves your Radiation Resistance by 20%.}
strings.103132: {}{|0xff00ff00 When you are tough, you take less damage.  This Perk adds +5% Damage resistance against all damage types.}
strings.103142: {}{|0xff00ff00 AKA Mule.  You can carry an additional 25 kg of equipment.}
strings.103152: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have a talent for hitting things at longer distances.  You get a +2 bonus to Perception for the purposes of determining range modifiers.  It's easier than ever to kill at long range!}
strings.103162: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk, you now have the ability to move quickly and still remain quiet.  You can Sneak and run at the same time.  Without this Perk, you would automatically stop Sneaking if you ran.}
strings.103172: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are a master of the outdoors.  This Perk confers the ability to survive in hostile environments.  You get a +25% bonus to Outdoorsman.}
strings.103182: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have mastered one aspect of bartering - buying goods far more cheaply than normal. With this Perk, you get a 25% discount when purchasing items from a store or another trader.}
strings.103192: {}{|0xff00ff00 Adds +3 skill points when you gain a new experience level. Skill points are given retro-actively for previous level-ups.}
strings.103202: {}{|0xff00ff00 The healing of bodies comes easier to you with this Perk. Each level of this Perk heals 4-10 additional hit points when using the First Aid or Doctor skills.}
strings.103212: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have the talent of finding money. You find additional money in random encounters in the desert.}
strings.103222: {}{|0xff00ff00 The critical hits you cause in combat are more devastating. You gain a 20% bonus on the critical hit table, almost ensuring that more damage will be done. This does not affect the chance to cause a critical hit.}
strings.103232: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have studied other human beings, giving you inside knowledge of their emotional reaction to you.  You will see the reaction level of the person you are talking to when involved in an in-depth conversation.}
strings.103242: {}{|0xff00ff00 The Slayer walks the earth!  In hand-to-hand combat all of your hits are upgraded to critical hits, causing destruction and mayhem.}
strings.103252: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have mastered the firearm as a source of pain.  With this Perk, any successful hit in combat with a ranged weapon will be upgraded to a critical hit if you also make a Luck roll.}
strings.103262: {}{|0xff00ff00 While Sneaking, if you hit a critter in the back, you will cause double damage using a hand-to-hand attack.  Silent Death is that kind of Perk.}
strings.103272: {}{|0xff00ff00 Each level of Action Boy (insert Girl if you wish) gives you +2 in Agility for the purpose of Action Point regeneration. This allows you to perform tasks faster.}
strings.103282: {}{|0xff00ff00 Mental Block is the ability to tune out any outside mental interference.  You must have learned this talent from a passing guru, or from a really late night at a bar.}
strings.103292: {}{|0xff00ff00 You get a one time bonus of 20 Hit Points total, scaling up until you hit Level 24.}
strings.103302: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are less likely to be hit by single shots in combat if you have this Perk. You get +50 to your Armor Class.}
strings.103312: {}{|0xff00ff00 Yum! Tastes like chicken. For each level of this Perk, you gain +20% to your Poison Resistance.}
strings.103322: {}{|0xff00ff00 A little late night cramming never hurt anybody, especially you. With this perk you are able to perform repairs more efficiently.}
strings.103332: {}{|0xff00ff00 The Medic Perk gives you a one-time bonus of +10% to the First Aid and Doctor skills.  Healing skills are a good thing.}
strings.103342: {}{|0xff00ff00 A Master Thief is proficient at stealing and picking locks. You gain +15 to Stealing and Lock picking. Steal from the rich, and give to you.}
strings.103352: {}{|0xff00ff00 Being a Speaker means you have a one-time bonus of +20% to Speech.  From the mouth of babes and all that.}
strings.103362: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your natural throwing accuracy is unmatched! Effective range with Throwing weapons is beyond what's normally possible regardless of your skill.}
strings.103382: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are much more adept at stealing than the normal crook. You can steal with the best of them, because with this Perk, you ignore size and facing modifiers when stealing from a person.}
strings.103392: {}{|0xff00ff00 Regaining of Sneak-Value is now 1 Hex/s faster. (Loss of Sneak-Value is still the same!)}
strings.103402: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your reputation is always positive to people. Without this Perk, a large negative reputation would have a bad effect on good natured people. This works in the reverse as well. Evil people will even treat Mr. Goodie Good as one of the gang.}
strings.103412: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have a sixth sense when it comes to finding the shiny. Looting old car-wrecks in particular, you have the ability to find what others would normally miss. That doesn't mean it's always worth the trouble, but you never know...}
strings.103422: {}{|0xff00ff00 The mark of the Explorer is to search out new and interesting locations.  With this Perk, you have a greater chance of finding special places and people.}
strings.103432: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk, you are less likely to be addicted to chems (50% less likely, actually), and you suffer half the withdrawal time of a normal person.}
strings.103442: {}{|0xff00ff00 The Pathfinder is better able to find the shortest route.  With this Perk, your travel time on the World Map is reduced by 25% for each level.}
strings.103452: {}{|0xff00ff00 Animals will not attack one of their friends, unless the animal is threatened or attacked first.  Exactly what an animal is in this world is open to debate.}
strings.103462: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have improved your ability to see distant locations, increasing the size of explorations on the World Map by one square in each direction.  You also have a better chance of finding special encounters.}
strings.103472: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk, you have gained the attention of a Mysterious Stranger, who will appear to help you from time to time.  If your ally is lost in combat, do not expect him (or her) to be replaced.}
strings.103482: {}{|0xff00ff00 You gain a +15% toward your Outdoorsman skill. You are more likely to avoid random encounters if you choose, and tend to find those "special" encounters more than most.}
strings.103492: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have learned to pack your equipment better. Now the manipulation of the items in the inventory are two times smaller.}
strings.103502: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have learned to increase your dialog options without understanding what you're talking about.  Each level of this Perk will increase your Intelligence by one, up to 10, for purposes of dialog only.}
strings.103512: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are indeed a Swift Learner with this Perk, as each level gives you an additional +5% bonus whenever you earn experience points.  This is best taken early.}
strings.103522: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your skills have improved to the point where you can pick an additional Tag Skill.  Tag skills increase twice as fast.}
strings.103532: {}{|0xff00ff00 The radiation of the wasteland has changed you!  One of your Traits has mutated into something else...}
strings.103542: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your body has more resistance for Critical.}
strings.103802: {}{|0xff00ff00 Physical pain makes the adrenaline flow. The lower your HP get, the more DT and DR you get (up to +5 for each).}
strings.103812: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are more alert outdoors and enemies are less likely to sneak up on you.  With this Perk you get a +3 to your perception in random encounters when determining placement.}
strings.103822: {}{|0xff00ff00 You pay much closer attention to the smaller details when reading.  You gain 50% more skill points when reading books.}
strings.103832: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are an expert when it comes to the fine art of handling explosives. They always go off when they're supposed to, as well as causing extra damage.}
strings.103842: {}{|0xff00ff00 You can roll with the best of them.  You gain +20% to your gambling skill.}
strings.103852: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk you gain +1 to your Strength.}
strings.103862: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk you gain +1 to your Perception.}
strings.103872: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk you gain +1 to your Endurance.}
strings.103882: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk you gain +1 to your Charisma.}
strings.103892: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk you gain +1 to your Intelligence.}
strings.103902: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk you gain +1 to your Agility.}
strings.103912: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk you gain +1 to your Luck.}
strings.103922: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your innocent demeanor makes stealing from people a little easier. You gain 40% to your Steal skill.}
strings.103932: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this Perk you immediately gain one experience level.}
strings.103942: {}{|0xff00ff00 If both item slots are empty, each unused action point gives you a +2 instead of +1 towards your armor class at the end of your turn, plus 1/12 of your unarmed skill.}
strings.103952: {}{|0xff00ff00 When it comes to pleasing sexually, you wrote the book.}
strings.103962: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your Karma shines twice as bright. Whether good or bad, your Karma is doubled for any kind of reaction or modifiers.}
strings.103972: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are agile, lucky, and always careful. This perk gives you a 50% chance to avoid setting off a trap that you stepped on. You are also less likely to detonate a trap that you try to disarm.}
strings.103982: {}{|0xff00ff00 You get +3% crit chance, and you can see exactly how much Bleed damage any patient (or target) has, as well as the bandage level.}
strings.103992: {}{|0xff00ff00 You get 1 extra slot in your companion limit, but don't forget that more than 5 is always a crowd.}
strings.104002: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are a very skilled negotiator.  Not only can you barter with the best of them, but you can talk your way into or out of almost anything.  With this Perk you gain +10% to both Barter and Speech.}
strings.104012: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are efficient at arranging your inventory in general.  This makes it much easier to carry that little extra you've always needed. You get +50kg to your maximum carry weight capacity.}
strings.104022: {}{|0xff00ff00 You do extra damage with fire-based weapons, and enemies always seem to die in the most painful fiery fashion.}
strings.104032: {}{|0xff00ff00 You recover 1 second faster from knockouts and knockdowns, and 20% faster from winded, suppression and disoriented effects.}
strings.104042: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are an adept salesperson.  With this Perk you gain +40% towards your Barter skill.}
strings.104052: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are much less likely to be knocked down in combat.}
strings.104062: {}{|0xff00ff00 The blood of a thief runs through your veins. With the Thief Perk, you get a one-time bonus of +10% to your Sneak, Lock pick, Steal, and Traps skills.  A well rounded thief is a live thief.}
strings.104072: {}{|0xff00ff00 You can wield weapons much larger than normally allowed. You gain a +3 to your strength for the purposes of Strength checks when trying to wield weaponry.}
strings.104082: {}{|0xff00ff00 You gain +3 Luck for the purposes of resisting critical strikes.}
strings.104092: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have inherent protection against physical attacks.}
strings.104102: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have inherent protection against energy attacks.}
strings.104112: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your body has adapted to better prevent hemorrhaging. With +20% bleed resistance, you bleed out slower.}
strings.104122: {}{|0xff00ff00 When it comes to resisting nasty critical effects, you are exceptionally strong. You are 15% more likely to pass critical rolls vs Strength.}
strings.104132: {}{|0xff00ff00 When it comes to resisting nasty critical effects, you are exceptionally perceptive. You are 15% more likely to pass critical rolls vs Perception.}
strings.104142: {}{|0xff00ff00 When it comes to resisting nasty critical effects, your Endurance is exceptional. You are 15% more likely to pass critical rolls vs Endurance.}
strings.104152: {}{|0xff00ff00 When it comes to resisting nasty critical effects, you are exceptionally agile. You are 15% more likely to pass critical rolls vs Agility.}
strings.104162: {}{|0xff00ff00 You recover 30% faster than normal from temporary ailments such as disorientation, suppressive fire and being winded.}
strings.104172: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have nerves of steel! You get +2 Luck for purposes of determining Critical Resistance and no DR penalty whenever you are disoriented, winded or suppressed.}
strings.104182: {}{|0xff00ff00 This Perk allows you to pull the trigger a little faster and still remain as accurate as before. Each weapon attack costs 10% less action points to perform.}
strings.104192: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your eye sight is phenomenal. You get +2 Perception for the purposes of determining sight range.}
strings.104202: {}{|0xff00ff00 Forget about limbs crippling, blindness, knock-downs! Your skeleton and titanium-alloy vital organs will not break even if a tank crosses you! All critical hits ignored.}
strings.104212: {}{|0xff00ff00 You know the weak spots of your armor by heart and you have learned to overcome them. A partial armor bypass is 20% less severe for you.}
strings.104222: {}{|0xff00ff00 Years of practice has finally paid off. Each weapon reload costs 20% less action points to perform.}
strings.104232: {}{|0xff00ff00 You don't care about people dying; you care about striking the final blow yourself! You instantly regenerate 50 AP for killing a player, half of that for NPC.}
strings.104242: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your awareness on the battlefield have made you less afraid of stray bullets. You gain +5 Charisma for the purposes of resisting suppressive fire.}
strings.104252: {}{|0xff00ff00 You're able to stimulate a divine presence and power toward correcting disease and disability. Your patients get bandaged only at two thirds normal rate. You also consume basic med kits slower.}
strings.104262: {}{|0xff00ff00 "Medic! FA! Stich meh!" - That's you they're calling for. You need 25 base AP less to heal your patients with first aid and doctor.}
strings.104272: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have learned to stop worrying and love the bomb. You get a 5% bonus resistance to explosive damage. You also heal 50 additional HP whenever you use the first aid or doctor skill.}
strings.104282: {}{|0xff00ff00 All healing item and defibrillator perks are unlocked for you regardless of skill level.}
strings.104292: {}{|0xff00ff00 You gain +5 to your healing rate.}
strings.104302: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your brutality has reached mountainous proportions, the weaker your enemies are, the more damage you inflict. You deal double damage with your critical strikes if target HP is very low.}
strings.104312: {}{|0xff00ff00 Like MacGyver, you're good when it counts. Your AP Regen+ increases up to +5/s as your HP drops.}
strings.104322: {}{|0xff00ff00 If there was an antonym for tunnel vision, that would describe you. You see to your front sides just as well as in front of you.}
strings.104332: {}{|0xff00ff00 When you thirst for blood, it's easier to get away with murder. You get Run Speed bonus up to 50% for killing any living creature. Effect is decaying over 10 seconds.}
strings.104342: {}{|0xff00ff00 If anybody except you tampers with your armed traps, they are in for a shocking surprise. Literally. You also get +5% electric resistance.}
strings.104352: {}{|0xff00ff00 Like Vlad, you have taken a peculiar interest in the art of impalement. Your spears now pierce multiple targets, assuming they line up properly.}
strings.104362: {}{|0xff00ff00 With each level of this perk, you come one step closer to mastering the art of mind over matter. You can eat one more food item before getting full. Bon appétit!}
strings.104372: {}{|0xff00ff00 With this perk you are able to retrieve more materials when sciencing items.}
strings.104382: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your hoarding has officially broken the laws of physics. While in the safety of your headquarter, there seem to be no limit to how much stuff you can carry. You probably should see a psychiatrist.}
strings.104392: {}{|0xff00ff00 Proper training and understanding you've adopted the art of dynamic carbine. When performing targeted bursts with an assualt rifle, only the target will be hit with the bullets.}
strings.104402: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are able to switch between 1 handed weapons without interuption and while moving with cooldown of 0.4s.}
strings.104412: {}{|0xff00ff00 You adapted the gambit lifestyle of going fast and dying young. Bursts with Spray and Pray weapons are more likely to land more bullets.}
strings.104422: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are able to cripple targets without prejudice while using a shotgun. Instead of knocking back the target, you will now inflict crippling blows ( If loaded with slugs, shotgun will act with default behavior ).}
strings.104432: {}{|0xff00ff00 Grenades are no longer removed from your hand and util slots when thrown but AP cost is increased by an extra 25 AP.}
strings.104442: {}{|0xff00ff00 Each time you are shot, your running speed is increased.}
strings.104452: {}{|0xff00ff00 You can walk while deployed costing 10 AP/hex.}
strings.104462: {}{|0xff00ff00 When at maximum action points, you only have half the aim delay with Small Guns.}
strings.104472: {}{|0xff00ff00 10% of combat damage taken is converted to bleed damage.}
strings.104492: {}{|0xff00ff00 PERK IS DISABLED, LEGACY DESCRIPTION. You are adapt at timing your shots and leading the target, your weapon projectile speed is increased by 33%.}
strings.104502: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are able to remain deployed even after a knockdown or knockback.}
strings.104512: {}{|0xff00ff00 PERK IS DISABLED, LEGACY DESCRIPTION. Deploy times are faster through rigourous training, the Action point cost of deploying is reduced by 33%.}
strings.104522: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your aimed arm shots will send the weapon flying out of your victims hands instead of crippling them!}
strings.104532: {}{|0xff00ff00 All your melee attacks will inflict poison effect.}
strings.104562: {}{|0xff00ff00 PERK IS DISABLED, LEGACY DESCRIPTION. Two to the chest, one to the head, every 3rd consecutive unaimed shot on a target will be a headshot. If this headshot is critical, it will have a critical power penalty of 2. Only works for pistols.}
strings.104572: {}{|0xff00ff00 You get +30 to Sneak value while running.}
strings.104582: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are an expert at utilizing even a tiniest cover in your favour. If you get any cover bonus at all (including bonus from deployment) you get additional +10% on top.}
strings.104592: {}{|0xff00ff00 You always were quick to recharge your energy after a run. Your AP+ Regen is increased by +5/s if you are in negative AP.}
strings.104612: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your body is radiating dim light. When at maximum HP, you share your Healing Rate to the nearest Teammate in a 10 Hex Radius. You also get +3 to your Healing Rate.}
strings.104752: {}{|0xff00ff00 Everything is moving so slowly... you need to get some more Jet, right NOW!}
strings.104762: {}{|0xff00ff00 You feel a burning desire to open another box of Tragic cards.}
strings.104802: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have killed a large number of people. This is generally not a good thing to get known for. People from the wrong side of the track will like you a little more, however.}
strings.104812: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your actions have revealed you to be a champion of the people. Your war against evil and villainy is widely known. Honorable people will respect you better.}
strings.104822: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have killed children, the youth of the wasteland. This is considered to be a really bad thing. You evil, evil person.}
strings.104832: {}{|0xff00ff00 You know sex. You know foreplay. You know how to please a member of the opposite sex and leave them hungry for more.}
strings.104842: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are the heavyweight champion of Northern California. You have gained fame, respect, the love of thousands... and a bonus to your toughness and unarmed skill.}
strings.104852: {}{|0xff00ff00 You probably saved that poor sap dying from malnutrition. You're a hero, kid.}
strings.104862: {}{|0xff00ff00 You helped that poor bastard deal with his grief. Someone should make you into a statue.}
strings.104872: {}{|0xff00ff00 You got hitched. Hey, it's your problem, not ours.}
strings.104882: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are a big, bright, shining star. Your sexual exploits are well-known throughout New Reno.}
strings.104892: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have been marked as a member of the Slaver's Guild. The tattoo on your forehead makes your profession evident to everyone you meet.}
strings.104902: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are a member of Jim & Jack & Jo's Lawyer Agency.}
strings.104942: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are a part of The Family.}
strings.104972: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are a Boreal Church member.}
strings.104982: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are a Game Master. Everybody loves you.}
strings.105002: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your character has been poisoned.  Poison will do damage over a period of time, until cured or it passes from your system.}
strings.105012: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your character is suffering from a significant amount of Radiation poisoning.  The more radiation damage, the more deadly the effect.}
strings.105022: {}{|0xff00ff00 This means your character has been seriously hit in one or both of your eyes.  This affects your Perception.}
strings.105032: {}{|0xff00ff00 The right arm has been severely hurt, and cannot function well.  If one arm has been crippled, you cannot use two-handed weapons.  If both arms have been crippled, you cannot attack with weapons.}
strings.105042: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your character's left arm has been severely hurt, and cannot function well.  If one arm has been crippled, you cannot use two-handed weapons.  If both arms have been crippled, you cannot attack with weapons.}
strings.105052: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your character has a crippled right leg.}
strings.105062: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your character has a crippled left leg.}
strings.105502: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your metabolic rate is higher than normal thus you heal faster, but take more damage from poison and are less resistant to bleed. You get +5 Healing Rate and -20 bleed resistance.}
strings.105512: {}{|0xff00ff00 A little slower, but a little bigger.  You may not hit as often, but they will feel it when you do!  Your AP regen is lowered as though you lost 3 agility, but your Strength is increased by 2.}
strings.105522: {}{|0xff00ff00 You are not quite as big as the other ordinary man, but that never slowed you down.  You are more likely to be knocked down (rolls -3), but you have 1 more Agility.}
strings.105532: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your aimed attacks show a lot of finesse. You don't do as much damage, but you cause more critical hits. +10% base critical chance, half bonus damage from critical hits.}
strings.105542: {}{|0xff00ff00 You swing harder, not better.  Your attacks are very brutal, but lack finesse.  You gain +20 Melee Damage, but lose 1 Agility.}
strings.105552: {}{|0xff00ff00 You shoot faster than most, but that doesn't mean you always hit the target. Attacks cost 10% less action points, but your maximum hit chance is 90% instead of 95%.}
strings.105562: {}{|0xff00ff00 Like Rasputin, it takes a lot to finally finish you off.  Your hit points can drop to twice the negative value before you finally die, but your maximum hit points are reduced by 10.}
strings.105572: {}{|0xff00ff00 150 years of radiation has gifted you with a strange and lizard like mutation. Your limbs have a 50% chance of spontaneously regenerating every 5 seconds and you take less damage from poison, but you get -5 to Healing Rate.}
strings.105582: {}{|0xff00ff00 Since you spent more time improving your skills than a normal person, you gain 8 additional skill points per experience level. The tradeoff is that you do not gain as many extra abilities. You gain a perk every four levels.}
strings.105592: {}{|0xff00ff00 You're a dealer, not a user. Your healing drugs are 50% more effective, but if you use them for yourself, they cost you twice the AP.}
strings.105602: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have an outstanding sight, enabling you to see farther, but you suffer from bad peripheral vision.}
strings.105612: {}{|0xff00ff00 Like Fortuna you are blind. To traps. Maybe that's why you have her blessing: you get -3 to your traps detection range, but you have a 50% chance of avoiding the effects of any trap.}
strings.105622: {}{|0xff00ff00 You have more innate abilities than most, so you don't spent as much time honing your skills.  Your primary statistics are each +1, but you get no tagged skills. |0xffff0000 WARNING! NOT FOR BEGINNERS, USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!}
strings.105652: {}{|0xff00ff00 By not paying attention to any threats, you gain +5 Charisma for the purposes of resisting suppressive fire while lowering your Armor Class. TL NOTE: Kamikaze, in Japanese, means "Divine Wind"}
strings.109842: {}{|0xff00ff00 The right arm has been severely hurt, and cannot function well.}
strings.109852: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your character's left arm has been severely hurt, and cannot function well.}
strings.109862: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your character has a injured right leg.}
strings.109872: {}{|0xff00ff00 Your character has a injured left leg.}
strings.200011: {}{Sun Tzu or Sunzi was a Chinese military general, strategist, and philosopher during the Zhou dynasty's Spring and Autumn Period. He is traditionally credited as the author of The Art of War, an extremely influential ancient Chinese book on military strategy and one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China. For the last two thousand years, the Art of War remained the most important military treatise in Asia, where even the common people knew it by name.
strings.200021: {}{Jiang Ziya was an ancient Chinese military strategist who helped King Wen and King Wu of Zhou overthrow the Shang Dynasty. After King Wu established the Zhou Dynasty, Lü Shang was enfeoffed at Qi, which later developed into a powerful state in the Spring and Autum and Warring States periods.
strings.200031: {}{Simu Rangju was a famous Chinese military general during the Spring and Autumn period, often seen as the spiritual successor of Jiang Ziya. He served in the State of Qi, defending it from the states of Jin and Yan, and went as high in the army as Da Sima, the Minister of War.
strings.200041: {}{Wu Qi was a Chinese military leader, Legalist philosopher, and politician in the Warring States period. His military work, Wuzi, is considered one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China. It is said there were two books on the art of war by Wu Qi, but one was lost, hence leaving the Wuzi as the only existing book carrying Wu Qi's military thoughts.
strings.200051: {}{Wei Liao is said to have either been a student of Lord Shang or an important advisor during the Qin Dynasty. However, there is little evidence to support either view. In any case, Wei Liao is believed to be the author of Wei Liaozi, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China.
strings.200061: {}{Zhang Liang was a strategist and statesman in the early Han Dynasty. He is also known as one of the "Three Heroes of the early Han Dynasty", along with Han Xin and Xiao He.
strings.200071: {}{Li Jing was a general and one time chancellor of the Chinese Tang Dynasty. In 630, Li Jing defeated the Eastern Tujue (Göktürk) Jiali Khan Ashina Duobi with just 3,000 cavalry soldiers in a surprise attack, allowing Tang to subjugate Eastern Tujue and reduce it to a vassal state. He and Li Shiji were considered the two most prominent early Tang generals.
strings.200081: {}{Alexander the Great was a Greek king of Macedon. By 326 BC, at the age of thirty, he had created one of the largest empires of the ancient world, stretching from Greece to modern-day Pakistan. Undefeated in battle, he is considered one of history's most successful commanders. For centuries to come, he was the measure against which military leaders compared themselves, and thousands of years later, his tactics were still taught throughout the world.
strings.200091: {}{Chandragupta Maurya (340 BC – 298 BC) was the founder of the Maurya Empire and the first emperor to unify most of Greater India into one state. He ruled from 322 BC until his voluntary retirement and abdication in favour of his son Bindusara in 298 BC.
strings.200101: {}{Hannibal was a Punic Carthaginian military commander, generally considered one of the greatest military commanders in history. One of his most famous achievements was at the outbreak of the Second Punic War, when he marched an army, which included elephants, from Iberia over the Pyrenees and the Alps into northern Italy. Historians have referred to Hannibal as "The father of strategy", because his greatest enemy, Rome, came to adopt elements of his military tactics in its own strategic arsenal.}
strings.200111: {}{Qin Shi Huang was the King of the state of Qin and the First Emperor of the Qin dynasty. He conquered all other Warring States and united China in 221 BC. He ruled until his death, which occurred in 210 BC despite an infamous search for an elixir of immortality.}
strings.200121: {}{Gaius Julius Caesar was a Roman general, statesman, consul and author, considered by many to be one of the greatest military commanders in history. }
strings.200131: {}{Zhuge Liang was a chancellor of the state of Shu Han during the Three Kingdoms period. He is recognized as the greatest and most accomplished strategist of his era, often being compared to the great Chinese strategist Sun Tzu. }
strings.200141: {}{Abū Sulaymān Khālid ibn al-Walīd ibn al-Mughīrah al-Makhzūmī, also known as Sayf Allāh al-Maslūl (Arabic for "Drawn Sword of Allah"), was a companion of the Islamic prophet Muhammad and known as Sahabah. He is noted for his military tactics and prowess, commanding the forces of Medina under Muhammad and the forces of his immediate successors of the Rashidun Caliphate; Abu Bakr and Umar ibn Khattab. It was under his military leadership that Arabia, for the first time in history, was united under a single political entity, the Caliphate. Commanding the forces of the nascent Islamic State, Khalid was victorious in over a hundred battles, against the forces of the Byzantine-Roman Empire, Sassanid-Persian Empire, and their allies, in addition to other Arab tribes. His strategic achievements include the conquest of Arabia, Persian Mesopotamia and Roman Syria within several years from 632 to 636. He is also remembered for his decisive victories at Yamamah, Ullais, and Firaz, and his tactical successes at Walaja and Yarmouk.}
strings.200241: {}{"Run time", having nothing to do with von Moltke, is the number of milliseconds it takes to run one hex. Normal "run time" is 200, meaning it takes 2 seconds to run 10 hex. The smaller the run time, the faster you run.}
strings.210011: {}{While the timer is active, you are considered to be engaged in combat. Some actions can't be performed while in combat.}
strings.210021: {}{When disoriented, you will have a hard time hitting your targets.}
strings.210031: {}{When winded, you are unable to run.}
strings.210041: {}{Bullets flying dangerously close to you makes you keep your head down. The perceived danger makes you unable to run.}
strings.210051: {}{The timer shows for how much longer you will lie helpless on the ground.}
strings.210061: {}{When you are bandaged, first aid is less effective. The percentage shown is how much less healing you get.}
strings.210071: {}{When the defibrillated timer is active, you are unable to be revived with a defibrillator.}
strings.210081: {}{If your character is dead, the timer tells you how long it is until you will be respawned.}
strings.210091: {}{If the timer is active, you have that amount of time to repent, or you will be exiled from your faction.}
strings.210101: {}{When you bleed, you take damage over time until all the damage has been absorbed, or you use a bandage or tourniquet to heal it.}
strings.210111: {}{When you are poisoned, you have -20 bleed resistance, -20 crit resistance and -30 healing rate. You heal one point of poison each healing tick (every 10 seconds).}
strings.210121: {}{Your character is suffering from a significant amount of Radiation poisoning.  The more radiation damage, the more deadly the effect.}
strings.210131: {}{Your character has a crippled left leg. You are unable to run with crippled legs.}
strings.210141: {}{Your character has a crippled right leg. You are unable to run with crippled legs.}
strings.210151: {}{Your character's left arm has been severely hurt, and cannot function well.  If one arm has been crippled, you cannot use two-handed weapons.  If both arms have been crippled, you cannot attack with weapons.}
strings.210161: {}{The right arm has been severely hurt, and cannot function well.  If one arm has been crippled, you cannot use two-handed weapons.  If both arms have been crippled, you cannot attack with weapons.}
strings.210171: {}{This means your character has been seriously hit in one or both of your eyes.  This affects your Perception.}
strings.210181: {}{The time until you can use your First Aid skill again.}
strings.210191: {}{The time until you can use your Doctor skill again.}
strings.210201: {}{The time until you can use your Traps skill again.}
strings.210211: {}{The time until you can take long lasting Class A type drugs again. Such drugs include Steady, Mentats, Buffout and Blood Moon.}
strings.210221: {}{The time until you can take short lasting Class B type drugs again. Such drugs include Psycho, Afterburner and Voodoo.}
strings.210231: {}{The time until you can take special Class C type drugs again. There's a variety of such drugs that you may find in your adventures...}
strings.210241: {}{While the timer is active, you have no extra AP regen, but you regain hit points each second.}
strings.210251: {}{While the timer is active, you are disoriented, but you regain hit points each second.}
strings.210261: {}{Your character can only eat and drink so much before getting full. If you are full, you have to wait for this counter to go down before you can eat something again.}
strings.210271: {}{Your every action will leave more of an impact on you. This is how long that effect will last.}
strings.210281: {}{You grow tired of reading once you've read too many books in a short period of time. If you are tired, you can read again when this goes down some more.}
strings.300012: {}{Amount of HP your character will heal each 5 seconds.}
strings.300022: {}{The chance that a broken limb will be restored every 10 seconds.}
strings.300032: {}{When you are knocked out, you are helpless for this long.}
strings.300042: {}{The Action Point cost of recovering from a knock down.}
strings.300052: {}{Every 5 AC increases the chance of turning an aimed hit into a torso hit by 2%, as well as decreasing your attacker's hit chance by 1%. You get full AC when running, 66% of it when walking and only 33% when standing still.}
strings.300062: {}{Reduces the amount of poison damage you take.}
strings.300072: {}{The amount of radiation you are exposed to is reduced by this percentage. Radiation Resistance can be modified by the type of armor worn, and anti-radiation chems.}
strings.300082: {}{Modifies the amount of Bleed Damage your character can take.}
strings.300092: {}{If your armor is bypassed by an enemy critical strike, this is the base amount of your armor that will still apply.}
strings.300102: {}{Your chance of being affected by suppressive fire.}
strings.300112: {}{Opponents will have their critical chance against you reduced by this percentage.}
strings.300122: {}{The base chance that you will successfully avoid knockouts and weapon drops.}
strings.300132: {}{The base chance that you will successfully avoid being blinded and disoriented.}
strings.300142: {}{The base chance that you will successfully avoid being winded, AP drained or having your arms or legs crippled.}
strings.300152: {}{The base chance that you will successfully avoid knockdowns and armor bypasses.}
strings.300162: {}{The number of actions that the character can take during one combat turn.}
strings.300172: {}{The number of Action Points that are regenerated each second, whenever your character is not busy with other actions.}
strings.300182: {}{Action Points regenerated each second, regardless of what your character does. Works even while running.}
strings.300192: {}{The maximum distance at which you can spot others.}
strings.300202: {}{How fast you can run, as measured in meters (hexes) / seconds.}
strings.300212: {}{The amount of bonus damage your character does in hand-to-hand combat.}
strings.300222: {}{Your base chance to score a critical hit with unaimed single shots, before being modified by the target's critical resistance.}
strings.300232: {}{Your base chance to score a critical hit with aimed single shots, before being modified by the target's critical resistance.}
strings.500011: {}{Find a way out of the caves}
strings.500100: {}{The Help-Desk is not available on the worldmap.}
strings.500200: {}{You fall down the ladder and hurt yourself. }
strings.500201: {}{You take @lex dmg@ points of damage and cripple your leg.}
strings.500302: {}{Looks like I need something to open this.}
strings.500400: {}{You feel like this may be a poor decision and decide against it.}
strings.500500: {}{You get lost in the tunnels but eventually find an exit.}
strings.600114: {}{You can't change leadership modules while you're dead.}
strings.601400: {}{The Cheap-Boy has encountered a serious problem and must be closed. Would you like to contact the Cheap-Boy Automated Help Desk (TM)?}
strings.601500: {}{Hello Wastelander, welcome to the Changelog page.
strings.601600: {}{Warning! You may be a victim of software counterfeiting.}
strings.2005001: {}{This is the western entrance to the Core. The ruins are being slowly buried by wind blowing in from the Mojave desert.}
strings.2005011: {}{A landslide tore this area in half long ago. Now it's a good place to find junk and other materials, as well as busy scavengers.}
strings.2005021: {}{Once a flourishing private school, it's been 150 years since a child learned anything more useful inside these buildings than 'wasteland is harsh'. Instead, dogs have been roaming the schoolyard.}
strings.2005031: {}{Originally a sugar beet factory in a town founded as a temperance colony, this historical building changed ownership more than two dozen times over the centuries. Last in the pre-war list of owners was the Gamma Gulp Corporation, which used it to distill it's dubious Gamma Gulp 'Beer'.}
strings.2005041: {}{This residential quarter once served as the hideout for a criminal organization. Recently, the old machines have been restarted by a Californian group called the Gunrunners, before they as well were driven off by ghouls and raiders.}
strings.2005051: {}{An old administration building, housing the biggest archives in Phoenix. Rumor says its underground is haunted by its former employees.}
strings.2005061: {}{The old police department building, located on a commercial avenue. Barricades were built after the war to isolate the main police building and the armory, but recently, a pack of deathclaws has taken over the area. Extreme caution is advised.}
strings.2005071: {}{'Always great savings at Warmart! Save money, live better', the advertisement says. The spacious store building invites a lot of unsavoury customers. A different kind of shopping experience.}
strings.2005081: {}{A production facility and storage for the famous American cola, and also now a source of precious bottle caps, legal tender throughout the wasteland. The addictive power of Nuka Cola is still prevalent, judging by the amount of hobos and junkies at its gates.}
strings.2005091: {}{This is the northern entrance to the Core, bordered by the back side of the Vault-Tec building.}
strings.2005101: {}{The Vault-Tec company headquarters in Phoenix. The building features a full-scale vault replica which was used as a showroom for wealthy citizens of the old world while the upper floors serve as a in-company library and research lab.}
strings.2005111: {}{The RobCo company headquarters in Phoenix. It remained intact after the great war, powered by an unknown source deep inside and maintained by its tireless robots, who sometimes still traverse the neighboring streets.}
strings.2005121: {}{The last standing hospital center amongst the city ruins. The place has been recently reported as overcrowded by dangerous creatures and mutants. Noone knows what is going on inside the building, as only few have ventured inside and even less returned.}
strings.2005131: {}{Library park was once a renowned cultural center. It still would be, if it wasn't for the Kleaners who have taken up residence in the basement.}
strings.2005141: {}{Central City Village was one of the richer residential areas in Phoenix. Now it's a good place for pre-war nostalgia. A place to envy comforts long lost.}
strings.2005151: {}{This is the southern entrance to the Core. If you keep your eyes open, you might spot some flying brahmisus.}
strings.2005161: {}{An old power plant in surprisingly good condition. Despite it's lack of professional maintenance, it still supplies several of the surrounding buildings with electricity.}
strings.2005171: {}{This old retirement home served as the headquarters for the Family for several years, until it was ravaged by a Lawyer attack in 2219. That event officially started war in Phoenix. To this day, the surrounding area is the staging ground for daily fights between rivaling splinter gangs and mobsters.}
strings.2005181: {}{This former commercial zone is now occupied by the C-Raiders. As it's name might suggest, it is a house of lust and depravity, desire and despair. Caution is advised.}
strings.2005191: {}{This residential area used to house the employees and families of the Paradise Valley Corporation. After the war, its luscious gardens turned into a swamp, ruled by the C-Raiders.}
strings.2005201: {}{One of Paradise Valley Corporation's laboratories. This one was officially used for research and tests on plants and animals. Unofficially, well, we're probably better off not knowing...}
strings.2005211: {}{The oldest water treatment plant in the region. It was closed already before the Great War, but has since been put to good use by members of the Family, before the Lawyers attacked.}
strings.2005221: {}{This area used to be frequented by many citizens. Relaxing, reading books, peacefully watching their children running to the playground... Now, only junk and trouble remains.}
strings.2005231: {}{One of Paradise Valley Corporation's laboratories. This one was officially used to develop new types of particularly resistant polymers.}
strings.2005241: {}{This is the eastern entrance to the Core. The Family buried some of their fallen members in the forest before heading further east.}
strings.2005251: {}{Previously used as a landfill, this place does not look much different to its pre-war guise. It also marks the entrance to the befittingly named "Junk Canyon" area.}
strings.2005261: {}{Using the cliffs as natural fortification, someone built themselves a little camp using junk from the nearby landfill. The viewing platform near the center allows for a nice view over the junk canyon.}
strings.2005271: {}{While the Macrosoft central administration building stood the test of time remarkably well, especially when compared to the ruins on the other side of the street, the last landslide compromised its structural integrity quite a bit.}
strings.2005281: {}{The seats overlooking the soccer field have survived a century of decay surprisingly well. Not much else in this area has, though. Before the war it was a popular place to camp, due to the proximity to the Encanto Park and it's multiple leisure activities.}
strings.2005291: {}{Apart from soccer, two golf courses and a boat house, the Encanto Park used to offer fishing activities in the artificial lagoon. They flew fish from all over the world just for the pleasure of catching it under the clear blue Arizona sky.}
strings.2005301: {}{Noone knows what the GM stands for, other than the raiders who erected this structure some decades ago. You probably wont be able to ask them, however, as the average life expectancy on GM Island is not that high.}
strings.2005311: {}{An old gas station was almost consumed by the junk canyon but luckily it was spared. Nowadays, prospectors and scorpions are looking for their fortune here.}
strings.2005321: {}{This is the epicenter of the incident that created this junk canyon area. Great care is advised when exploring those caves, earthquakes happen for a reason.}
strings.2005331: {}{Global Motors used to own this luxurious hotel in the heart of the Encanto Park, once an honorable Phoenix Point of Pride. The hotel is closed "for the time being", but the nature trail can still be enjoyed. Sort of.}
strings.2005341: {}{Much like GM Island, this area features an artificial structure on the lake, constructed by raiders in the past. Which does not mean it is abdandoned, by any stretch. Tread carefully.}
strings.2005351: {}{This big parking lot served the nearby Vault-tec Enterpresis branch quite well, but nowadays, it's not much more than a junkyard. Someone used the abundance of junk to their advantage and constructed some fortifications. Whoever constructed it is long gone, however.}
strings.2005361: {}{Being this close to Lake Encanto and its resort made Palm lane one of the premier locations for the nouveau-rich. As expected, their money did not save them, although some tried their best in prepping.}
strings.2005371: {}{Constructing an administration building just north of their power plant, Global Electrics, a subsidiary of Poseidon Oil, wanted to keep a close watch over their operations. While the surrounding area does not hold up too well, the central building is in surprisingly good shape, even the forcefield is still intact.}
strings.2005381: {}{Operational all the way until the end, Meat Your Maker Slaughterhouse allowed the citizens of Phoenix to keep up the fashionable habit of eating other animals while still pretending to care for their well being. Mind your step as you approach the meat grinder hole, by the way.}
strings.2005391: {}{In the 1890's, Goldfield was booming with life. They had three saloons, a boarding house, a general store, a blacksmith and even a school. Then the vein faulted, the mine shut down and the town crumbled. For a while it was a popular attraction as a ghost town. Parts of it was rebuilt as a museum. Then the bombs took it all away.}
strings.2005401: {}{One of the major aortas of the grand city, the Superstition Freeway was part of the interstate line eventually connecting Phoenix with New Mexico. This segment is relatively uncluttered by broken down vehicles. Now if only you had a Highwayman...}
strings.2005411: {}{Not much is known about this large warehouse, except that it used to belong to RobCo Industries. What happened inside those walls, and what is left of it, remains a mystery.}
strings.2005421: {}{Your typical industrial district, complete with the self-storage units and the gritty local bar. Turn on the jukebox, close your eyes and pretend you have a cold beer, and for a moment it's almost as if the apocalypse never happened.}
strings.2005431: {}{The mine was only really operational for about five years in the late 19th century, until the grade of the ore suddenly plummeted. Several attempts were made to reopen, but ultimately they all failed. The gold is gone.}
strings.2005441: {}{Some Apaches believe that the hole leading down into the lower world, or hell, is located in the Superstition Mountains. Winds blowing from the hole are sometimes making dastardly sounds, like growling of monsters, so the local legend says.}
strings.2005451: {}{This area was once used as part of a golf course. Unlike most other parts of Phoenix, it has arguably been put to better use after the war, serving as relatively fertile farm land. If only it wasn't for those damn sporeplants and geckos.}
strings.2005461: {}{Out of a wide variety of kitchen utensils, knives and letter openers, only the "Stallona" Combat Knife from the SharpWit production line survived the true test of time. Turns out the blade really was quite durable.}
strings.2005471: {}{Despite it's lack of real estate, Oldtown has seen it's fair share of action over the years. The quiet spot is typically favored by caravans and traders, who in turn attract people who attract raiders. The raiders scare the commerce, leaving themselves soon thereafter. As the caravans return, the cycle continues.}
strings.2005481: {}{Nobody brings dead bodies to the Green Acres anymore, except if the bodies are alive when they get there. And they certainly don't get the ceremonial burial of the olden days. Rumor has it that the mausoleum underneath the cemetery is haunted.}

strings.600005: {}{An entrance to Phoenix' preserved area. This side is usually occupied by the Lawyers.}
strings.602005: {}{An entrance to Phoenix' preserved area. This side is usually occupied by the Brahminboys.}
strings.603005: {}{An entrance to Phoenix' preserved area. This side is usually occupied by the Hound Square.}
strings.604005: {}{An entrance to Phoenix' preserved area. This side is usually occupied by the Family.}
strings.606005: {}{An entrance to Phoenix' preserved area. This side is usually occupied by the V-Technologists.}
strings.607005: {}{An entrance to Phoenix' preserved area. This side is usually occupied by the Boreal Church.}
strings.700005: {}{The Jim & Jack & Jo's Lawyer Agency's Headquarters, located inside a pre-war high-tech facility. Only Lawyers are allowed inside.}
strings.702005: {}{The Brahminboys' Headquarters, built on the ruins of a pre-war farming facility. The initial compound constantly growed to finally become a powerful town.}
strings.703005: {}{A dusty grouping of tents on the side of the road. It looks on the surface to be nothing more than a haven for junkies. A well calculated illusion.}
strings.704005: {}{The Family's Headquarters, located inside an old hotel. The ground floor is dedicated to external business, and travelers are often passing by.}
strings.706005: {}{The V-Technologists' Headquarters, a vault hidden underground. The whole place is kept secret, and heavily defended against any intrusion.}
strings.707005: {}{A small church nestled gently atop a steep hill, overlooking a scenic lake. There is a surprising amount of nearby plant growth.}
strings.800005: {}{A recently settled mine hidden in the desert and exploited by Lawyers. Creatures are often wandering in its glowing corridors.}
strings.802005: {}{An open air minesite located in the mountains. Brahminboys are facing hostile creatures in the area, compromising their plans.}
strings.804005: {}{A mine exploited for years by the Family. It is said horrors are awaiting beneath its river's dark waters.}
strings.9102005: {}{An old, small military airfield that has been engulfed in strange meteorological phenomenons ever since the bombs fell. Approach with care.}
strings.9103005: {}{Once a popular local recreational area, it is now home to strange beasts lurking in the dense forest, according to rumours spread by not so trusty looking wastelanders.}
strings.14300005: {}{Bob's firing range for all your firing needs!}

strings.3: {}{Data is already stored in your Pip-Boy.}
strings.4: {}{Not enough memory, please clear up some space.}
strings.12: {}{There's a label on the disk, but it's faded and worn and you can't really make out what it says. It's obviously very old.}
strings.22: {}{There's a label on the disk, but it's faded and worn and you can't really make out what it says. It's obviously very old.}
strings.32: {}{There's a label on the disk, but it's faded and worn and you can't really make out what it says. It's obviously very old.}
strings.101: {}{To any wastelander reading this holodisk, let it be known that we have discovered a perfect place to build a new society. In a region called Arizona, there is a city that was apparently unspoiled since the Great War. There we found food, electricity and plenty of other resources for everyone! This city is called Phoenix, and it's a real hope for a much brighter future! We invite everyone wishing to join and assist us to travel to Arizona and meet us there. Be careful on the way!}
strings.102: {}{(Hold left-click and select the 'hand' icon to download data to disk. Then, open your Cheapboy and press 'O' to access your extracted holodisk data at any time.)}
strings.201: {}{Your ValueTec Cheap-Boy 2000 has all the necessary equipment to track, everything! From Action Points to Zone Control, the Cheap-Boy 2000 has more utilities than any competing product.
strings.502: {}{Scribbled immaculately on this well maintained holodisk are the words "Top secret, uninteresting, sciency stuff. Do NOT read.}
strings.1001: {}{I had all this loot, but then I ran into a mudcrab, that terrible creature. I had to drop all the loot to get away safely. I marked the location on this map, so that if I die, my enemy gets extra loot.}
strings.1002: {}{A yellow post-it note is attached to the disk. It says "This disk contains a virus! If you read it, all your shit will be totally wiped, or something."}
strings.1011: {}{Came across this old shack last night after the raid. Didn't look like much, but when I went inside to take a piss, I found what looked like a really well preserved highwayman! Gotta get back when the others aren't around, no way I'm gonna share this sweet ride with them!}
strings.1021: {}{I stashed most of the loot in an old dumpster. Gotta come back for it later, hopefully nobody else finds it before then.}
strings.1031: {}{That dirty, back stabbing cocksucker! I know he hid it SOMEWHERE in this area, but for the life of me I can't find it! I really regret not torturing him for longer before I killed him.}
strings.1041: {}{I feel like a proper pirate, hiding my treasure and shit. Safer this way though.}
strings.1051: {}{Another one of those places. Should check it out eventually, when there's nothing better to do.}
strings.1061: {}{Guess you really would say just about anything when tortured. Can't believe I fell for it though. Nothing of value here.}
strings.1071: {}{Had to hide all of it. With my gold fish memory, best mark it on the map too.}
strings.1511: {}{Those raiders have been following me for days, but I think I finally lost them. Gonna hide the stuff in this old church just in case though.}
strings.1601: {}{Looks like whoever used to live here left in a hurry. Gotta remember to come back later, might still be something left to scavenge!}
strings.1611: {}{I heard gunshots coming from this farm the other night. Might be worth checking it for spoils later.}
strings.1701: {}{I thought I saw a crashed vertibird, might have some good stuff. Too bad it was crawling with deathclaws. Not worth losing my life over it!}
strings.1711: {}{Wow, this place is fucking gold mine! Couldn't even carry a fraction of the stuff! Gotta hurry back before Sam gets wise, I think he might already be on to something!}
strings.5002: {}{These pre-war Army Field Manuals typically contain detailed information and how-tos for procedures important to soldiers serving in the field. This one is labelled "Proper usage of Firearms".}
strings.5012: {}{These pre-war Army Field Manuals typically contain detailed information and how-tos for procedures important to soldiers serving in the field. This one is labelled "Proper usage of Automatic Weapons".}
strings.5052: {}{These pre-war Army Field Manuals typically contain detailed information and how-tos for procedures important to soldiers serving in the field. This one is labelled "Critical Strikes".}

strings.101: {}{Your basic all leather apparel. Finely crafted from tanned brahmin hide.}
strings.201: {}{Polished metal plates, crudely forming a suit of armor.}
strings.301: {}{A self-contained suit of advanced technology armor. Powered by a micro-fusion reactor, with enough fuel to last a hundred years.}
strings.901: {}{XVB01 a designation for a series of vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) aircraft. Gamazon Prime is written on the side of this hull.}
strings.1001: {}{XVB01 a designation for a series of vertical take-off and landing (VTOL) aircraft. Gamazon Prime is written on the side of this hull.}
strings.1101: {}{The information contained in this folder is highly valuable to certain people. Precious find.}
strings.1201: {}{A tiny, but very useful thing if you need to pick some locks. It does, however, require some skill.}
strings.1301: {}{Even in a post-nuclear world, there are many uses for it.}
strings.1401: {}{A rocket with a large explosive warhead.}
strings.1601: {}{Uhh, I don't know how did you get this but... congratulations.}
strings.1701: {}{High tech armor, made out of advanced defensive polymers.}
strings.1801: {}{Well, in the current circumstances, it will be hard to find a use for it.}
strings.2001: {}{Pretty thick notebook. The pages are untouched. Could be useful for taking notes.}
strings.2301: {}{A bunch of different low-quality metal parts. Might come in handy.}
strings.2401: {}{A roll of gray adhesive tape used before the Great War to fix just about anything.}
strings.2501: {}{A short screwdriver with plastic handle. It's not a good idea to use this as a weapon.}
strings.2601: {}{Old rags, smeared with gun oil. Not so useful.}
strings.2801: {}{An old and dirty piece of cloth. Using this to deal with bleeding could have serious consequences.}
strings.3101: {}{A brick of ammunition, .44 magnum caliber, hollow-points.}
strings.3201: {}{A cylinder containing an extremely flammable liquid fuel for flamethrowers.}
strings.3401: {}{A case of ammunition, .223 caliber, Full Metal Jacket.}
strings.3501: {}{A brick of small, lightweight ammunition, standard military issue.}
strings.3601: {}{A brick of small caliber ammunition, upgraded super-armor-piercing rounds.}
strings.3701: {}{A rocket shell, with a smaller explosive, but designed to pierce armor plating.}
strings.3901: {}{A medium sized energy production unit. Self-contained fusion plant.}
strings.4001: {}{A healing chem. When injected, the chem provides immediate healing of minor wounds.}
strings.4101: {}{Coins from a time before the war. There is an image of a sophisticated man imprinted on the other side.}
strings.4301: {}{On old-style ice chest. The hinges are in good working condition.}
strings.4401: {}{On old-style ice chest. The hinges are in good working condition.}
strings.4601: {}{An average sized bag. Made from weaved brahmin hairs.}
strings.4701: {}{A small kit containing basic medical equipment. Bandages, wraps, antiseptic spray, and more.}
strings.4801: {}{A chemical solution that bonds with radiation particles and passes them through your system. Takes time to work.}
strings.4901: {}{A bottle containing a home-brewed antidote for poison. A milky liquid with floating pieces of radscorpion flesh. Takes time to work.}
strings.5101: {}{A high explosive, consisting of nitroglycerin mixed with the absorbent substance kiselguhr. Includes a timer.}
strings.5201: {}{A Wattz Electronics C-Radz model Geiger Counter. Detects the presence and strength of radiation fields.}
strings.5301: {}{A pillbox of mind-altering chems. Increases memory related functions, and speeds other mental processes. Highly addictive.}
strings.5401: {}{A RobCo Stealth Boy 3001 personal stealth device. Generates a modulating field that transmits the reflected light from one side of an object to the other.}
strings.5501: {}{This is a Vault-Tec water chip. They are typically packaged in groups of five to a box. Very expensive item nowadays.}
strings.5601: {}{A set of dog tags, suitable to use as a proof of death of said person. Bring them to local law enforcment while their bounty is still up to claim a reward.}
strings.5801: {}{A Wattz Electronics Holodisc tape. This particular tape looks to be into very poor condition.}
strings.5901: {}{A Wattz Electronics C-U model motion sensor. Detects the movement of biological material over a distance of meters using a tuned radar device. Having one in your inventory will also help you avoid outdoor encounters (+20% Outdoorsman skill).}
strings.7101: {}{A strange piece of fruit. No preservatives and no additional food coloring added.}

strings.7501: {}{A tool set, containing various useful tools, including pliers.}

strings.7801: {}{An image of a singer. Obviously, very old. The image has a felt coating that is still in good condition.}

strings.25301: {}{This chip controls the flow of power into a car's electric engines. Many drivers quickly burnt out this chip through frequent rapid acceleration. Still a valuable part to have-- if you only had a car to install it in.}
strings.25401: {}{Some car-owners installed this regulator, that doubles your car's mileage between charges, but most drivers didn't care how much juice their cars consumed, after all, power's cheap and plentiful so why worry.}
strings.25501: {}{This slightly crumpled piece of paper grants you access to all areas of Vault City, except the Vault itself, during daylight hours only.}
strings.25601: {}{This is a set of false Citizenship Papers. They look authentic enough, but you doubt they could pass a serious inspection.}
strings.25701: {}{This is an ancient time-piece known as a pocket watch. Time ran out for this keepsake, many long years ago.}
strings.25901: {}{After Burner is a powerful methamphetamine chewing gum that stimulates the central nervous system. The initial euphoric rush rarely lasts more than a few minutes, but during that time, the user is filled with a rush of energy & strength.}
strings.26001: {}{This antidote cures the addiction effects of Jet.}
strings.26101: {}{A Red Ryder BB gun with the name 'Jonny' scratched on the stock.}
strings.26201: {}{An old pair of sturdy rubber work boots. They look durable enough to keep out sludge, at least for a while.}
strings.26301: {}{This is a message from the leader of the Slags to the townspeople of Modoc.}
strings.26501: {}{This heavily padded leather jacket is unusual in that it has two sleeves. You'll definitely make a fashion statement whenever, and wherever, you rumble.}
strings.26601: {}{This hand-held radio doesn't work but it looks as though it's still in pretty good condition. Some of its parts could probably be salvaged for use in other radios.}
strings.26701: {}{This relic of the Vault was probably used to contain some sacred sacrament. The Holy number 13 is emblazoned on the side of this precious link to your people's past, and hopeful future.}
strings.26801: {}{Polyester resin billiard ball. It has the number '8' on it..}
strings.26901: {}{A pile of broken metal parts from the insides of a very unlucky robot.}
strings.27001: {}{A bunch of 12Gauge slugs. They seem to have been hand loaded.}

strings.27201: {}{The rare root that gives healing properties to the powder of healing.}
strings.27301: {}{A very powerful healing magic- though it will bring the feeling of sleep to your head.}

strings.30201: {}{The label on this holotape reads: "Gecko Economic Data." It's difficult to interpret most of the technical charts, tables, and formulae here, but the majority of the information seems to highlight the advantages of a Vault City -- Gecko alliance.}

strings.30601: {}{An electronic security key, color coded red.}

strings.31601: {}{This is a Jimmy Hats brand condom, a very reliable brand. This one contains phosophorous red dye #5 and has a yummy cinnamon bun flavor... or so you heard.}

strings.31901: {}{Wooden triangle rack for pool. Very important thing for the game.}
strings.32001: {}{Polyester resin billiard ball. It has the number '12' on it.}

strings.32601: {}{A pair of loaded dice. Don't be flashing these around the casino.}
strings.32701: {}{This is a hard boiled chicken egg painted with colored dyes.}

strings.33001: {}{This is wreckage from a Vertibird. Looks like it crashed here months ago.}

strings.33201: {}{Lad's Life was a pre-War camping and hunting magazine aimed towards the young adult male demographic. Despite it being meant for pre-War enthusiasts, the magazine offers legitimate survival tips that can be applied to life right now.}

strings.33401: {}{A hypodermic needle full of powerful poison.}
