strings.33701: {}{This is the holodisk you got from Lynette.}
strings.33801: {}{This is the holodisk you got from Westin.}
strings.33901: {}{This holodisk contains reports of NCR caravan schedules and security information. It's addressed to Darion and signed "F". With this info, it's easy to see how the raiders have avoided capture.}
strings.34001: {}{A set of very detailed plans for a Cybernetic Canine Guard Unit. With this and the right facilities, a person just might be able to build a robo-dog.}
strings.34101: {}{The bearer of this document is Security Clearance A-Prime as authorized by the authority of the President of the New California Republic. It's signed by President Tandi.}
strings.34201: {}{This pin says you're an official New California Ranger. Look -- it's got a code wheel and everything! Strange, how it made its way all the way to Arizona.}
strings.34301: {}{A map of the surrounding area -- it won't help you much -- but there are code names on it for the Ranger safe houses in the north.}
strings.34801: {}{An intact scorpion egg. Hopefully it doesn't hatch anytime soon.}
strings.34901: {}{Seeking to steal market shares from RobCo's personal computing devices, VaultTec modified a cheap spin-off device of Chinese manufacture and released it under the sister company ValueTec. The resulting Cheap-Boy 1999c was intended to replace the PIP-boy 2000 as the default computer in the VaultTec Vaults, but the devices were only delivered to Arizona before the Chinese trade embargo put an end to the imports. While not as aesthetically pleasing as the PIP-boy, the ability to modify and enhance the Cheap-Boy has made it a popular choice for more pragmatic adventurers.}
strings.35001: {}{The front cover of the magazine depicts racks of Tommy guns on the front cover, advertising its 12 full color pages and articles such as, .308: America's Greatest Ally, Top 5 Battle rifles Rated!, CZ-57 Minigun: New AND Legal!, and Flamers for Home Defense?.}
strings.35101: {}{A magazine that dedicated to the do-it-yourself repairmen, with advice ranging from basic repairs to advanced projects. The magazine also reviewed various tools and had general advice articles for the amateurs, such as "Working a Job & What Tools to Keep In Your Toolkit" and "0 Appliance Repairs Tips".}
strings.35201: {}{A computer-oriented magazine, focusing on the latest Pre-War programming topics.}
strings.35401: {}{A set of papers for receiving resource package delivery at @lex zone@.}
strings.35501: {}{It is a large book, heavily damaged by the Great War or subsequent events.}
strings.35601: {}{A piece of scrap metal that can be broken down into smaller parts.}
strings.35701: {}{These rounds seem to be hand-loaded and are not quite as powerful as .45ACP. At least they should work.}
strings.35801: {}{Ammunition for Gauss weapons. The large size and high velocity of the round essentially nullifies any sort of armor along with the stopping power of a big round.}
strings.36101: {}{Ammunition. This cartridge appears to be ammo for the HN Needler Pistol. Each 'bullet' is a small hypodermic designed to inject a target with its contents upon impact.}
strings.36201: {}{Ammunition. This cartridge appears to be armor-piercing ammo for the HN Needler Pistol. The hypodermic tips are made of a strange alloy and are incredibly sharp.}
strings.36401: {}{This is the drive mechanism for a robot.}
strings.36501: {}{It is a large book, heavily damaged by the Great War or subsequent events.}
strings.36601: {}{The case is locked using a combination lock. The sound it makes suggests that it contains several items. An entry on the top side of the case made with a marker indicates the owner's call sign. Somebody probably would want this item and you have a feeling the value of the contents are time sensitive.}
strings.37101: {}{Ammunition. This cartridge appears to be stimulant ammo for the HN Needler Pistol. The needles are filled with combat sustaining agents to help injured soldiers stay effective.}
strings.37201: {}{It is a large book, heavily damaged by the Great War or subsequent events.}
strings.37301: {}{An electronic security key, color coded red.}
strings.37701: {}{Miscellaneous computer parts with various functions. A computer geek's dream.}
strings.37801: {}{A chocolate chip cookie. Its so yummy that it will bestow an enlightened state upon your mind!}
strings.37901: {}{An enhanced version of the basic leather armor with extra layers of protection. Finely crafted from tanned golden gecko hide.}
strings.38001: {}{Polished metal plates, finely crafted into a suit of armor.}
strings.38101: {}{A superior version of Combat Armor with many improvements over the standard version.}
strings.38201: {}{This flamethrower fuel uses an advanced super-burn mix.}
strings.38301: {}{The cover of this book is slightly burnt and the name is illegible. This is a kind of fictional story in the romance genre. Spicy pictures included. Nice.}
strings.38401: {}{A thick book that covers the history of antiquity. It's full of knowledge.}
strings.38501: {}{This is a horror story about cursed King who changes into a huge and terrifying Lizard under cover of night. Delightful.}
strings.38601: {}{A folder full of all sorts of useful information.}
strings.38701: {}{A folder full of all sorts of useful information.}
strings.38801: {}{A folder full of all sorts of useful information.}
strings.38901: {}{This is a homemade awl. It's probably not as reliable as a real one, but it's better than nothing.}
strings.39101: {}{The beaker is a simple glass container for stirring, mixing and heating liquids commonly used in many laboratories.}
strings.39201: {}{A small grey-colored glass jar used for containing specimen.}
strings.39401: {}{A standard surgical instrument to temporarily stop bleeding during surgery.}
strings.39501: {}{Anatomical tweezers. An excellent tool for delicate work.}
strings.39601: {}{It is a large book, heavily damaged by the Great War or subsequent events.}
strings.39701: {}{An organic seed-spike that the carnivorous plants spit at potential food or seed carriers.}
strings.40701: {}{A "Big Frigger" Power Fist from BeatCo. Considered by many to be the ultimate weapon to use in unarmed combat. This one has upgraded power servos for increased strength. Powered by small energy cells.}
strings.40801: {}{A small kit containing basic emergency medical equipment. Bandages, wraps, antiseptic spray, and more.}
strings.40901: {}{This bag contains instruments and chems used by paramedics in the field. The tools contained are specifically designed for high trauma and emergency cases.}
strings.41001: {}{A set of locksmith tools. Includes all the necessary picks and tension wrenches to open conventional pin and tumbler locks. This set also includes some special tools for more difficult mechanical locking mechanisms.}
strings.41101: {}{This is the second generation Wattz Electronics Micromanipulator FingerStuff electronic lockpick. For defeating electronic locks and security devices. This Mark II version includes updated software and interface tools.}
strings.41201: {}{You see a can of high-class lubricant. Great stuff for cleaning weapon.}
strings.41301: {}{This is a temporary ID badge. It has a red stripe through it, which seems to indicate that you are a "Stables Researcher.".}
strings.41501: {}{A set of spectacles for eye correction.}
strings.41701: {}{This is the oxygen tank for Salvatore's breathing apparatus.}
strings.41801: {}{This tank looks suspiciously like an oxygen tank, but there is a small skull and crossbones symbol etched in the bottom. If you hadn't examined it closely, you wouldn't have seen the symbol.}
strings.41901: {}{You see a bundle of parts that are clearly labeled "GX-9 Air Purifier". Using your incredible deductive skills, you decide that they are probably parts for a broken air purifier.}
strings.42001: {}{This is a small chit used to pay mine workers. You should be able to find someone to trade it in.}
strings.42201: {}{This chip appears to be for some sort of large industrial machine. Beneath the dirt and dust, it appears to be in surprisingly good shape.}
strings.42401: {}{This is a piece of the disgruntled stone monument you found out in the desert. Although many of your village would no doubt regard it as a sacred relic, somehow you suspect that you have been cheated.}
strings.42801: {}{A box of assorted medical supplies. Nothing an unskilled person can make use of though.}
strings.42901: {}{This gold tooth used to belong to someone, but it's yours now.}
strings.43001: {}{A 75mm Howitzer shell. The casing has mostly corroded away, but you can make out these letters. EXP. 9-25-98.}
strings.43101: {}{A closed briefcase. While it appears to have been closed for quite some time now, it's still in good condition. You wonder what's in it.}
strings.43201: {}{This is the box you received from Big Jesus Mordino to give to Ramirez at the Stables. It is open, and you have removed the Jet that was inside.}
strings.43301: {}{This is a pair of fashionable and deadly-looking mirrored shades. Just having them in your inventory makes you feel cool.}
strings.43401: {}{A caravan wagon converted from the wrecked remains of an ancient automobile.}
strings.43501: {}{A caravan wagon converted from the wrecked remains of an ancient automobile.}
strings.43701: {}{Every card in this set is a red queen. Must make for some boring games.}
strings.43801: {}{A key for the Arroyo Temple door.}
strings.43901: {}{Some fuzz you found in a pocket.}
strings.44001: {}{A jar of chemical components for various appliances.}
strings.44101: {}{These dog tags have the owner's name scratched off and the name "Blondie" scrawled on the back. Beneath the name is the number "11.".}
strings.44201: {}{These dog tags list the owner as "Angel-Eyes." Beneath the name is the number "16.".}
strings.44301: {}{These foul-smelling dog tags list the owner as "Tuco Benedicto Pacifico Juan Maria Ramirez," followed by the number "27.".}
strings.44401: {}{This is a crumpled map of pre-war Northern California. Reno and the surrounding caravan trails are outlined in red, and there is a red "X" far to the east of Reno with "Raiders" scrawled beneath it.}
strings.44501: {}{A Badge worn by the Sheriff of a town.}
strings.44601: {}{A set of plans for some kind of weapon. The plan is only half complete so it can't be used for crafting, but you can probably learn a lot from it.}
strings.44701: {}{This holodisk contains incriminating information on Bishop's secret deal with NCR. Apparently, Bishop hired mercenaries to attack Vault City in the hopes that Vault City would turn to NCR for military aid. This holodisk is audio only and has no text data. Vault City might be interested in this.}
strings.44801: {}{This account book lists a series of monthly payments made to the mercenary band from the Bishop Family in New Reno. The payments depend heavily on how much "pressure" the mercenaries put on Vault City. Vault City might be interested in this.}
strings.45001: {}{You see a piece of paper with writing on it. It looks like it's part of a code of some sort. Unfortunately, the code is incomplete. If only you could find all three pieces. You can make out the following: 1. Physics Password KSLJ, 2. Chemistry Password TIU, 3. Biology Password INTL.}
strings.45101: {}{You see a piece of paper with writing on it. It looks like it's part of a code of some sort. Unfortunately, the code is incomplete. If only you could find all three pieces. You can make out the following: KJ: Ken-Lee-9, ASPO- Lo-S, VR- Dnky-Pnch-.}
strings.45201: {}{You see a piece of paper with writing on it. It looks like it's part of a code of some sort. Unfortunately, the code is incomplete. If only you could find all three pieces. You can make out the following: 7313, hi-S12908, 98790}
strings.45301: {}{This is three pieces of a single page that, when assembled, reveal three passwords. The text reads: 1. Physics Password KSLJKJ: Ken-Lee-97313, 2. Chemistry Password TIUASPO- Lo-Shi-S12908, 3. Biology Password INTLVR- Dnky-Pnch-98790}
strings.45401: {}{This switch is the final component of an explosive device.}
strings.45501: {}{The trunk is a great place to store your stuff.}
strings.45601: {}{An old door key, rusted from the tip. It has the emblem of Adams School on it.}
strings.45701: {}{A field office report for the membership drive in the True Faith.}
strings.45801: {}{The Holodisk with certain technological data on it. This one holds Small Guns data inside.}
strings.45901: {}{The Holodisk with certain technological data on it. This one holds Big Guns data inside.}
strings.46001: {}{The Holodisk with certain technological data on it. This one holds Energy Weapons data inside.}
strings.46101: {}{The Holodisk with certain technological data on it. This one holds Armor data inside.}
strings.46201: {}{The Holodisk with certain technological data on it. This one holds Medicine data inside.}
strings.46601: {}{A sheet of folded paper with the word "TCHAIKOVSKY" written on it.}
strings.46801: {}{It's some kind of salad and a sandwich made out of what you think is Brahmin meat covered in a thick dark yellow sauce. There is also a strange pickled green vegetable on the side.}
strings.46901: {}{A very strong liquor or cleaning fluid, you decide.}
strings.47001: {}{A questionable sexual device. If you need to ask, you don't want to know.}
strings.47101: {}{It appears to be some kind of romance novel written by Dorothy Rixon. The cover has a woman laying on a bed surrounded by a hundred flowers.}
strings.47201: {}{This holodisk is labeled "Hubology: The Truth Behind the Lies". It looks like it works with your PIPBoy.}
strings.47301: {}{You see your sixth toe. It is a small mutated part of yourself. For some reason, you feel a terrible sense of loss as you look at the tiny amputated toe.}
strings.47401: {}{A flower pot of daisies. Aren't they nice?.}
strings.47501: {}{A bunch of good quality metal parts salvaged from a car. Might be interesting to technicians.}
strings.47601: {}{It's a sheet of paper with instructions for manufacturing what appears to be some kind of explosive. All you need is some nitroglycerine and diatomite, whatever that is. Best to mix those things on a workbench.}
strings.47901: {}{These are computer parts that look like they slot into the interior of a machine. The fact that they say "Poseidon Oil" and "Navigational Computer" on them lead you to believe they fit into a Poseidon Oil Navigational Computer.}
strings.48301: {}{Well, THIS would have been good to have at the beginning of the goddamn game.}
strings.48401: {}{This is your ear. The Masticator bit it off during the fight and spit it on your unconscious body. If you are reading this, it probably means you will be reloading soon. Of course, it is possible this item has some special value.}
strings.48501: {}{Somebody probably wants this, a vendetta, a debt or perhaps just business being settled. Don't hold onto it for too long, looks like it's already decaying.}
strings.48601: {}{A chunk of Uranium Ore. This ore seems to have been processed somehow. It seems heavier.}
strings.48701: {}{"Zaius, Marcus isn't doing anything about that mutant-hater Jacob and his damned conspirators. First they disable the air purifier... and then what? I found their secret meeting tunnels. I figure a body or two down there could implicate Jacob. If you want in, let me know. And burn the damn note this time!" -Signed, Francis.}
strings.48801: {}{This is the drive mechanism for a K-9 series robot.}
strings.48901: {}{This key seems to be carved from bone. Hopefully animal bone.}
strings.49101: {}{You see a small doll with a big red nose. For some reason, you don't trust this seemingly-innocent child's toy.}
strings.49201: {}{An encoded passkey that provides access to high security areas.}
strings.49401: {}{This is a small chit probably used to pay Kokoweef Mine Workers.}
strings.49501: {}{An old keycard with a security level, you can make out the words "Phoenix Archives" on it.}
strings.49601: {}{A pair of boxing gloves that smell faintly of sweat. They look like they have seen a lot of use: many old blood stains still remain.}
strings.49701: {}{Someone has "accidentally" slipped metal plates into these boxing gloves. It could technically be considered cheating, but you prefer to think of it as an increased opportunity to dispense bone-crunching damage.}
strings.49901: {}{This Pip Boy lingual enhancer consists of a storage holodisk, a microfilament cord, headgear, and an optical sensor that is placed over the user's right eye. When used, an optical flash transmits an entire dictionary into the user's memory, permanently improving the user's speech skills.}
strings.50301: {}{A read only computer memory module containing technical information. Apparently your Cheap-boy can't read it. maybe the module is too old.}
strings.50401: {}{A read only computer memory module containing medical information. This module details perception enhancements.}
strings.50501: {}{A read only computer memory module containing medical information. This module details strength enhancements.}
strings.50601: {}{A read only computer memory module containing medical information. This module details intelligence enhancements.}
strings.50701: {}{This is a partially decomposed body of a humanoid creature.}
strings.50801: {}{An inflatable rubber sex doll ready for some long and hot wastelandish nights. This one is a "Kink Dotcom" model.}
strings.50901: {}{This inflatable rubber sex doll has a torn seam. It's obviously been well used.}
strings.51601: {}{This Pip Boy medical enhancer consists of a storage holodisk, microfilament cord, headgear, and an optical sensor that is placed over the user's left eye. When used, an optical flash transmits a dictionary of physician skills and know-how into the user's memory, permanently improving the user's doctor skill.}
strings.52001: {}{Leftover parts and bits from a failed attempt at recycling.}
strings.52101: {}{A small box used to collect money for the poor.}
strings.52301: {}{It looks like a geological survey map of the Bay area.}
strings.52501: {}{A medical injection instrument of some kind. It looks very high tech. You don't know what it's filled with but it appears to have only one dose left.}
strings.52601: {}{This guy has a weird red uniform you have never seen. It looks like he died from dehydration.}
strings.52701: {}{This guy has a weird red uniform you have never seen. It looks like he died from dehydration.}
strings.52801: {}{This guy has a weird red uniform you have never seen. It looks like he died from dehydration.}
strings.53201: {}{That kind of bottles are usually used for storing and transportation of water.}
strings.53301: {}{This bottle contains the most valuable thing in the wasteland - fresh water.}
strings.53401: {}{Seems like this piece of rope was teared by someone.}
strings.53601: {}{A piece of natural mineral formations. Contains iron and its compounds. Very heavy.}
strings.53701: {}{A hard nature formation. Contains various useless and useful substances.}
strings.53801: {}{With a bit of machining. this barrel could fit perfectly on some rifles.}
strings.54101: {}{Absolutely usual post-nuclear American ciggarettes of famous trademark "Nukeboro".}
strings.54301: {}{Worn hatchet. Its blade is still in good condition.}
strings.54401: {}{An anti-personnel blast-mine. Step on it and your leg is gone.}
strings.54501: {}{An anti-personnel blast-mine. Step on it and your leg is gone. It is armed.}
strings.54801: {}{When you open the envelope, you find a yellowed note with the words "I hope you didn't forget" and an almost completely faded photograph of some kind of giant metal tower that looks like the letter 'A'. The year on the back of the photo is 2074.}
strings.54901: {}{Your PipBoy shows only a set of random symbols when you try to read this holodisk.}
strings.55900: {}{You now have an idea what "Instant Spaghetti" means.}
strings.56201: {}{This holodisk is encrypted and requires special equipment to be cracked. Judging by a a serial number carved into its side panel, this disk is old enough to have seen (and survived) the war.}
strings.56701: {}{A television dinner. Despite popular belief, this is actually edible.}
strings.57001: {}{A piece of a map of the surrounding area. This might be of value to the factions.}
strings.57301: {}{This dangerous chemical is used to craft explosive devices Luckily, this particular bottle has already seen some preparation, otherwise you wouldn't be able to hold it in your hands.}
strings.57401: {}{This eerie looking liquid is potent radscorpion poison.}
strings.57501: {}{An explosive commonly used by the military and construction companies to demolish buildings.}
strings.57601: {}{One of the most powerfal and brisant explosives, widely used by the military and relatively safe to storage.}
strings.57701: {}{With the right chemicals at hand, one coule probably use this to make plastic explosives.}
strings.57801: {}{An extended capacitor, useful for applications where storage of a lot of energy is required.}
strings.59001: {}{These energy cells seem to be patched together from recycled small energy cells in a do-it-yourself manner and are weaker than military-grade small energy cells.}
strings.59101: {}{There is a train that comes from Namibia and Malawi...}
strings.59501: {}{A sturdy machete, perfect for garden work, jungle adventures or killing sprees.}
strings.61001: {}{Polished metal plates, finely crafted into an advanced suit of armor.}
strings.61101: {}{Fancied from a torn leather jacket and some metal plates, this armor is purpose built by the sewer rats to be light and flexible enough to crawl through sewers while being somewhat protective against sharp animal claws.}
strings.70601: {}{A number of 9mm bullets, jacketed hollow points.}
strings.70701: {}{A number of 9mm bullets, specially designed armor-piercing bullets.}
strings.71001: {}{High caliber pistol rounds designed for the Colt m1911}
strings.71501: {}{Intermediate cartridge developed for use in the AK-47.}
strings.71601: {}{A long range cartridge specifically designed for super long range sniper kills in the deserts of the middle east or the streets of Phoenix.}
strings.71701: {}{Standard issue full power rifle cartridge, used in soviet machine guns.}
strings.71801: {}{Specially designed round for the Dragunov sniper rifles but compatible with the PKS, although at no particular gain.}
strings.72801: {}{A special type of ammunition used in the RAD smg.}
strings.72901: {}{Ammunition used by the Electro and Rad smg's. Small needles made of a superconducting alloy with their own power supply.}
strings.73201: {}{A tank filled with napalm, incompatible with standard flamers.}
strings.80001: {}{This vehicle has been built on the base of M1025 Hummer, produced by AMG at the turn of the 20th and 21th centuries. Most of the parts are taken from its predecessor so the car inherits the quality of the original. Used by the Brotherhood of Steel as a workhorse for any kind of work. Hummer - fast and reliable way to travel.}
strings.80201: {}{Vehicle has been assembled in the barn, by a bunch of drunk raiders. Very unreliable, but fast and maneuverable.}
strings.80301: {}{Vehicle has been assembled in the barn, by a bunch of drunk raiders. Very unreliable, but fast and maneuverable.}
strings.80401: {}{Vehicle has been assembled in the barn, by a bunch of drunk raiders. Very unreliable, but fast and maneuverable.}

strings.85401: {}{Don't use this. If you can see this, blame the technical designer.}

strings.87401: {}{The note says: @lex intro@ I saw a bunch of @lex evtcr@s stashing @lex evtitem@s all around @lex mapname@.}
strings.87601: {}{Note to self: Remember to go pick up the loot cache that I hid in @lex contInfoTime@ in @lex mapname@.}
strings.92801: {}{A box containing %s units of Flamer Fuel.}
strings.92901: {}{A box containing %s units of Flamer Fuel Mk. 2.}
strings.100401: {}{You have a good feeling about this cap.}
strings.100601: {}{If it wasn't warm and flat it might not look so much like urine.}
strings.100701: {}{It's hard to imagine this foul smelling liquid was once a soft drink. It's completely undrinkable, but perhaps the oily texture gives it another, more unorthodox use?}
strings.100801: {}{Hey, it can't be worse than Nuka Cola Cherry, right?}
strings.100901: {}{What's the worst thing that could happen when drinking glowing green liquid?}
strings.133801: {}{A bundle of clean towels, now if only there were a shower...}
strings.133901: {}{A brass compass, the needle is spinning in circles.}
strings.134201: {}{A golf club, well go on...Give it a swing.}
strings.134301: {}{A set of steel handcuffs, there are no keys.}
strings.134401: {}{A barbed fishing hook, its made out of steel. Still sharp too!}
strings.134601: {}{An oil lamp, there is still a little bit of oil inside.}
strings.134801: {}{A leather medical brace. Its seen some use but it looks usable.}
strings.134901: {}{A copy of Mercenaries: Issue 01. The print date is, October 10th 2077.}
strings.135001: {}{The first issue of Modern Samurai! Some of the pages are torn but its still readable.}
strings.135201: {}{A spindle of thread, perfect for sewing clothes... Or skin.}
strings.135301: {}{A pair of old leather boots. They dont fit you.}
strings.135401: {}{An old fountain pen. The ink has long since run dry, but it sure does look nice.}
strings.135601: {}{An old record from before the war. It's labled monkey business, the artist's name is scratched off.}
strings.135701: {}{It's an old camera. All the film has been used up, if only there was a way to develop it...}
strings.135801: {}{It's a cuddly bunny rabbit! Give it a squeeze and watch, as all your troubles disappear.}
strings.136101: {}{A sharpening stone, y'know... For making stuff sharp.}
strings.136201: {}{A short metal chain, possibly made of steel.}
strings.136301: {}{This valuable Cuban cigar can bring you bliss for a short while, especially when you're admiring a nice sunset. Cuban cigars are considered the finest in the world.}
strings.136401: {}{A copy of the best seller, Space Squids.}
strings.136501: {}{A small bundle of string. You never know when you'll need.}
strings.136601: {}{This is a special edition Vault-Tec, Vault-Boy Wrist watch. It has a number seven engraved on the back.}
strings.136701: {}{A pre-war wrist watch. The battery has stopped, and the hands have stopped at 4:20.}
strings.136801: {}{An old tin of boot polish. Its oil content seems to have preserved it, someone could still use this.}
strings.136901: {}{Looks like a dog collar. Most likely a for dogs.}
strings.137001: {}{A bottle of cologne. The bottle is still full, though it doesn't smell like much.}
strings.137101: {}{A cut throat razor, for all your shaving purposes. Still sharp!}
strings.137201: {}{At one time, this ring probably meant a lot to someone.}
strings.137301: {}{I wouldn't try to put this on any of the dogs that roam Phoenix.}
strings.137401: {}{These gloves are so well made. Mmm, so soft!}
strings.137501: {}{This is really fine silverware manufactured before the war. Surely it is worth something to someone.}
strings.137701: {}{A true gentleman's accessory. Are ya smoking yet?}
strings.137801: {}{A glass jar containing black ink. It's still good.}
strings.137901: {}{A fine leather belt with a steel buckle.}
strings.138101: {}{Lip, stick? It's labled "cherry red". Not quite cherry anymore, but not quite pre-war either.}
strings.138201: {}{A magnifying glass, used to make small print readable. Someone may have a use for this. Probably not a good idea to use this to burn ants, nowadays.}
strings.138301: {}{A small bag of marbles, hours of fun! Some kid must have lost these.}
strings.138401: {}{A pair of mens leather shoes. They were clearly made for someone with very large feet.}
strings.138501: {}{A tie like this commands great power and respect... A power tie, if you will.}
strings.139001: {}{The primary use of this clip board was to hold a sheet of paper in place... How exciting.}
strings.139201: {}{A small set of old keys. Whoever these belonged to is long gone.}
strings.139301: {}{An old book bound in leather. Even if the pages have yellowed and are starting to crumble, there's still a lot of knowledge to be found in this book.}
strings.139401: {}{A pencil. The point is dull. It needs some sharpening.}
strings.139601: {}{A bottle of V-Tec Pharma painkillers. The label says the pills should expire in a few months.}
strings.139801: {}{You finally have them! A pair of balls, which are made of pure steel. Marion was not very cautious. They are yours now.}
strings.140001: {}{It's a Wattz Battery pack that might be usefull as a backup energy source. It's not in perfect condition but you can feel that there is still energy in it.}
strings.140101: {}{A security access card. Still in working condition.}

strings.140701: {}{These teeth will make a nice necklace or something.}

strings.141401: {}{The separated claw or hand or paw of a grey deathclaw.}
strings.141501: {}{This is a part of a centaur. Or did it come from a Floater? What is a centaur, anyway? You don't know what it is or what to do with it, but hopefully someone in the scientific community does.}
strings.141601: {}{Use on a farming field to get new fertilizer item.}

strings.149101: {}{It has the same diameter as 40mm grenade, but you wouldn't be THAT crazy now would ya?}
strings.150001: {}{Mounting a suppressor reduces the loudness of a weapon, but it still is far away from being silent by any stretch of imagination.}
strings.150101: {}{By changing the flow of gas at the muzzle of a gun, the muzzle brake helps to bring down the muzzle for quick follow-up shots but as a side effect it increases the audible range of the weapon.}
strings.150201: {}{The added weight and length of the barrel makes for a more accurate weapon but at the same time makes quick target acquisition a little more difficult.}
strings.150301: {}{With a shorter barrel, less energy is imparted on the bullet, making long range shots harder but greatly helping in a CQB situation.}
strings.150401: {}{A quality stainless steel chrome-lined barrel will take a long time to degrade and is always a good investment to make a gun more reliable.}
strings.150501: {}{A light barrel improves the overall handling of a weapon but is inherently more fragile.}
strings.150601: {}{If you don't like what you see when looking down your irons, put these ones on.}
strings.150701: {}{Perfect for small range engagements and quick target acquisition, but only for as long as you don't drop your rifle on the concrete too often.}
strings.150801: {}{These help quite a bit at night but don't accomplish a lot during daytime.}
strings.151201: {}{A very useful tool for room-clearing, as long as it doesn't turn into hall-clearing.}
strings.151301: {}{Useful for making sure you're not overlooking something or someone.}
strings.151401: {}{A vertical frontgrip gives you some extra leverage to hold down the muzzle during full-auto and burstfire, but purists say that the traditional rifle grip leads to much better accuracy at long ranges, of course.}
strings.151501: {}{This kind of grip can provide the shooter with a more natural way of gripping the weapon, bringing up the sight picture just a split second faster.}
strings.151601: {}{Being able to adjust the stock's length to your liking makes for a much more convenient shooting experience, at least as long as you don't try to bash doors in with your stock.}
strings.151701: {}{Smooth adjustments in length, a comfortable buttpad and a padded cheekriser provides you with all the long-range luxury you need.}
strings.151801: {}{A hydraulic buffer will soften the recoil impulse and make it easier to continue firing accurately. At least as long as the oil doesn't freeze up or blow out in extreme temperatures.}
strings.151901: {}{While a light and handy weapon is favorable, this kind of stock doesn't necessarily instill the greatest deal of confidence in its structural integrity under stress.}
strings.152001: {}{A great way to turn your rifle into a handy little package if you don't need while making sure it's there for you should you need it at a moment's notice.}
strings.152101: {}{If you afraid of running out of bullets, this stock will be a great stand-in club.}
strings.152201: {}{Slings allow for various different shooting techniques to be applied, increasing your accuracy as long as you dont get yourself tangled up in it.}
strings.152301: {}{A less mushy trigger than what your gun of choice usually would come with.}
strings.152401: {}{A precisely machined trigger with a clean break and light pull. Just make sure you don't lose any of those tiny screws when maintaining your gun.}
strings.152501: {}{A heavy trigger allows the responsible safety-oriented wastelander to carry his gun with a cocked hammer and a disengaged safety.}
strings.152601: {}{Tired of having to retrain your muscle memory each time you use a different gun? Just change the controls to your preferred style with this all-inclusive toolkit!}
strings.152701: {}{Adding that extra locking lug to the bolt makes sure your gun wont be able to blow up, unless you want it to.}
strings.152801: {}{By adjusting spring strengths, gas port sizes and part weights you might be able to get a slightly faster cyclic rate of fire out of your gun, if you don't mind the odd out-of-battery fire every once in a while.}
strings.152901: {}{By making sure you get all the chunkyness in all the right places you now make any gun fit for military service.}
strings.153001: {}{By loosening up the tolerances, it is possible for some operating mechanisms to continue operating under adverse conditions. The downside is your mechanism will lock up slightly differently each time, resulting in a net loss of repeatability and thus accuracy.}
strings.153101: {}{By removing all contact that barrel has with the stock, a lot of varying environmental and personal effects on each shot are eliminated, thus increasing consistency and accuracy.}
strings.154001: {}{Continuous gunfire heated the muzzlebreak up so much, that now you can barely recognize it.}
strings.154101: {}{This Reflexsight has a break through its glass. It severely hinders your ability to look through it.}
strings.154201: {}{Holding this foregrip feels really weird. It does more harm then good.}
strings.154301: {}{This stock is in a weirdly half-retracted position. Holding the weapon feels really weird.}
strings.154401: {}{The trigger triggers way too soon for your comfort.}
strings.154501: {}{It really doesn't sound like your weapon could perform any worse right now.}
strings.154601: {}{This is a bent barrel, the bullets might be a little less accurate.}

strings.765101: {}{Modern gauze bandage made of cotton. A plastic porous film prevents direct contact and minimizes wound adhesion. Useful to treat minor bleeding.}
strings.765201: {}{A simple yet effective device, twisting the stick applies pressure on the skin and underlying tissues of the limb, temporarily occluding blood flow. Most effective when the patient is in a life-threatening state as a result of continuous bleeding.}
strings.765301: {}{This simple-to-use automated external defibrillator uses computer technology to analyze the heart rhythm and advice the user whether a shock is required. Treats ventricular fibrillation or tachycardia by administering high joule shocks that depolarizes the heart muscle. Designed for use by lay persons, it is more time consuming and less effective than a manual defibrillator.}
strings.765401: {}{This Lifepak 78 manual external defibrillator comes with a built in electrocardiogram reader to help with diagnostics. High joule shocks administered through paddles on the patient's chest allow normal sinus rhythm to be restored. Capable of treating a wider range of conditions than the automated external defibrillator, but require a more detailed medical knowledge to operate.}

strings.1400401: {}{The oldest and weakest of the typical .30 caliber rifle cartridges used by the great powers in the 20th century, but still a .30 caliber.}
strings.1400501: {}{This round was specifically designed for the US light rifle program in world war II. It's a good bit faster than other pistol rounds but does not quite compare to a .30 caliber rifle round.}
strings.1400601: {}{Originally based on a similarly sized round made by mauser, the tokarev is definitely on the fast side when compared to its contemporaries.}
strings.1400701: {}{The .357 Magnum is just a little bit longer than its little brother, the .38 Special, and revolvers in .357 can usually fire the .38's as well. Using .357 in a revolver built for .38 special is not advised however, as the chamber pressure is a good three times higher and will rip the gun apart.}
strings.1400801: {}{A wimpy round by modern standards, the .38 Special was a common cartridge used in law enforcement services all over the world from the 1920's on.}
strings.1400901: {}{Even though this round was designed in 1873, it remained popular on the civil market due to the iconic rifles that used this round like the "Trapdoor" Springfield.}
strings.1401001: {}{This Cartridge has a perforated case to vent propellant gases backwards, cancelling out the recoil of the projectile.}
strings.1401101: {}{One of the first true intermediate cartridges, designed to be small enough to be have managable recoil and muzzle climb while being powerful enough to be effective out to 300 meters.}
strings.1401201: {}{For a time this was the most powerful handgun cartridge in the world. That time did not last long but it still is nothing to sneer at.}
strings.1401301: {}{The most powerful handgun cartridge in the world, at least as far as mass production is concerned. Easily surpasses some 'Full Power' rifle cartridges in muzzle energy.}
strings.1401501: {}{A cartridge designed during the first world war to use in upcoming Heavy machine guns for tanks and planes, hence the designation "Tank und Flieger"}
strings.1401601: {}{Much like the other anti-tank and anti-material rifle rounds of other nations, this is a cartridge developed between the two world wars for the PTRD-41 and was later used in heavy machine guns.}
strings.1401701: {}{An assortment of various blackpowder cartridges, powder and ball packaged together for quick reloading. These are not actually moddern cartidges, the paper just holds all the ingredients you need to reload a muzzle loader.}
strings.1401801: {}{Used in the american civil war, these projectiles were much more accurate and deadly than standard lead balls fired from muskets due to the added spin stabilization, but the rifling also meant they took longer to reload.}
strings.1402001: {}{Crudely made iron spheres, filled with explosives. Handle with care.}
strings.1402101: {}{These were used in the American Civil War in the Spencer and other carbines. As carbines, they are designed for short range and don't have the power of a full length rifle or musket.}
strings.1402201: {}{In this unique cartridge, the case extends over the top of the bullet, designed to expand upon firing to seal the cylinder gap on the Nagant revolver. This unique feature allowed the Nagant to be properly silenced.}
strings.1402301: {}{A popular early smokeless powder revolver cartridge which would later spawn the .44 Magnum. Not quite as powerful as its big brother.}
strings.1402401: {}{This cartridge was originally developed in the 1920's in Germany but was picked up by the russians to serve in their SVDK rifles. It is somewhat comparable to .338 lapua in terms of power, but less suited for long range shooting.}
strings.1402501: {}{A very popular and cheap plinking round, the .22 Long Rifle has taught generations the fundamentals of marksmanship before one moved on to "proper" calibers.}
strings.1402601: {}{"Wildey's Here!" It says so right on the box of these neatly packed small little magnum cartridges.}
strings.1402701: {}{The Hale rocket was the first rocket to use vent holes cut at an angle to create spin stabilization, making it much more accurate than its predecessors like the congreve rocket. They were used to some effect in the American Civil War and thereafter.}
strings.1402801: {}{The ammunition for the Ampulomet are glass spheres filled with incendiary liquid, propelled with a blackpowder charge.}
strings.1402901: {}{Around the time of the development of the Fedorov Avtomat, large quantities of 6,5 Arisaka were purchased by the Russians and so it was decided to adapt the Fedorov to it instead of producing a new one.}
strings.1403001: {}{These rockets were developed for military use by Robert H. Goddard, who worked tirelessly on maximum rocket fuel efficiency and would later build the first liquid fueled rocket, setting the stage for modern space travel.}
strings.1403101: {}{The cartridge for the SIG MCX Spear achieves its high power through an exceedingly hot load and a chamber pressure, that would lead to critical failures on normal firearms. To compensate for this, the cartridge cases have been strenghted, which comes at additional cost and weight.}
strings.1403201: {}{Designed to be as flat-shooting and fast as possible, the 7,5mm FK round is one of the most powerful handgun rounds, without producing borderline unpractical amounts of recoil.}
strings.1403301: {}{Based on a standard 8mm mauser bullet, the massively oversized cartridge propels it at over 1200 meters per second, a good 30% faster than standard rifle rounds.}
strings.1403401: {}{The Grosse Panzergranate 61 was designed and used by the Waffen-SS as a makeshift anti-armor weapon. Like other such grenades, it is propelled by a blank cartridge and contains a shaped charge warhead.}
strings.1403501: {}{The 6,5x55mm Swedish round was one of the more successful 6mm rifle cartridges and lived on beyond the 21st century as a hunting round. It's less powerful than its 7mm and 8mm contemporaries but produces less recoil. This particular round is fitted with a roundnosed bullet rather than a spitzer round, however, leading to less armor penetration.}
strings.1403601: {}{A single round for the 20mm Lahti anti-material rifle. After all, a single round should be enough for anyone, or anything.}
strings.1403701: {}{This is a specially designed subsonic ammunition with a very heavy projectile, in order to achieve maximum power without breaking the sound barrier. It was designed for the silent sniper system in vietnam, but the local humidity and overall climate supposedly degraded its accuracy and the project was scrapped.}
