strings.1502901: {}{You can create a new Artifact with these.}
strings.1503001: {}{This dated anomalous activity detector produces an alarm signal when anomalous particles enter a special chamber as you approach an anomaly. It can also register the presence of artifacts and measure the distance to the nearest one. The distance is indicated by the frequency of the sound the detector emits.}
strings.1503101: {}{This last generation anomalous activity detector can be used to locate anomalous formations and has a color diode panel, which not only indicates the direction of artifacts, but also measures the distance to them.}
strings.1503201: {}{A next generation scientific detection scanner. Thanks to three modernized detection chambers, the position of artifacts is shown on a special display screen. When closed, the device registers only radiation and anomalies.}
strings.1503401: {}{The Cossacks-brand vodka is a clear distilled liquor composed of water and ethyl alcohol. Vodka is made from a fermented substance of either grain, rye, wheat, potatoes, or sugar beet molasses. Vodka�fs alcoholic concentration usually ranges between 35 to 70 per cent by volume.}
strings.1503501: {}{Crates might contain useful gear. Not every crate will have something inside, many will be empty but an empty crate could be useful to store gear in, if it is in a good location.}
strings.1503601: {}{Crates might contain useful gear. Not every crate will have something inside, many will be empty but an empty crate could be useful to store gear in, if it is in a good location.}
strings.1505101: {}{You see a jukebox with a blue neontube. Suprisingly in very good condition - maybe you should try to insert a gramophone record.}
strings.1505401: {}{Play us a song you're the guitar man. Play us a song tonight. Well we're all in the mood for a melody. And you've got us feelin' alright.}
strings.1800001: {}{Who needs complex magazine mechanisms when you can just load up six whole barrels instead?}
strings.1800101: {}{The cavalryman's weapons of the early 18th century. This model is in .65 caliber and features a 12" barrel.}
strings.1801001: {}{The precursor to the shotgun with its iconic flared out barrel.}
strings.1802501: {}{A musket-like weapon designed for cavalrymen who want more than a pistol. It has a short barrel and weighs much less than a musket or caliver.}
strings.1802601: {}{The only air rifle that has seen actual military use, used by austrian snipers from 1780 to around 1815.}
strings.1804501: {}{This gun was designed for naval battle in the mid 19th century, setting off all barrels at the same time. Great for hurting a group of enemies and your shoulder.}
strings.1805001: {}{An early french volley gun with 10 barrels which are fired in the same moment in a salvo.}
strings.1806501: {}{An early precursor to the grenade launcher, this device uses blackpowder to launch a grenade further than a man could throw them. At least as long as the powder properly worked and didn't have the grenade explode at your own feet.}
strings.1810001: {}{Hardened knuckle grip that is actually made out of steel. They protect your hand, and do more damage, in unarmed combat.}
strings.1811501: {}{This primitive axe is great for busting rocks, trees and kneecaps.}
strings.1812001: {}{A razor tipped polearm. The shaft is wooden, and the tip is worked steel.}
strings.1813501: {}{A ball that releases a cloud of poison when thrown at an enemy's face. Simple yet effective.}
strings.1814001: {}{A cast iron ball, filled to the brim with blackpowder and set off with a burning fuze.}
strings.1820001: {}{Known as the 'Gun that won the west', this revolver is a living piece of history. Hopefully it still works.}
strings.1820101: {}{This was the most widely used handgun in the american civil war. Has room for 6 .44 caliber balls.}
strings.1820201: {}{This is one of the earliest lever-action firearms that lead the way for the long standing winchester repeating arms company. It offers unparalleled volume of fire from a single chamber, but with very low power behind each bullet.}
strings.1821001: {}{Someone took the time to chop the last few inches off the barrel and stock of this shotgun. Now, the wide spread of this hand-cannon's short-barreled shots makes it perfect for short-range crowd control.}
strings.1821101: {}{An old, simple side by side breech loader. Nothing to go wrong here.}
strings.1822501: {}{These smoothbore carbines were used by various branches of the American military at the time in moderate numbers and is one of the first firearms designed by Samuel Colt.}
strings.1822601: {}{Turret rifle were a short lived alternative to revolvers, where multiple chambers are laid out in a radial fashion, with the added benefit of always having at least one loaded chamber pointed at the shooter's face, explaining the short lifetime of this concept.}
strings.1823001: {}{Arguably the best of the 'Muskets' of the American civil war, because this wouldn't actually need to be a musket, a shorter rifle would have been much more effective.}
strings.1823101: {}{A remarkably accurate rifle for its time due to its hexagonal rifling, it was used in the american civil war by special sharpshooter units.}
strings.1824001: {}{A very big and bulky blackpowder gun, usually used in fortifications where it would not need to be moved a whole lot, but who says you couldn't use it in the field, too?}
strings.1825001: {}{The Gardner gun is an early machinegun relying on multiple barrels, a hand crank and gravity to provide sustained fire.}
strings.1827001: {}{The hale rocket launcher was used in the American Civil War in an area bombardment role with limited effect, but if someone had had the idea to put the launch tube onto their shoulder, it would have been the first Bazooka.}
strings.1830001: {}{An improved version of the classic Brass Knuckles. The Spiked Knuckles do more damage, tearing into the flesh of your opponent in unarmed combat.}
strings.1831001: {}{A military or police baton. Heavy wood.}
strings.1832001: {}{A razor tipped polearm. The shaft is wooden, and the tip is sharpened steel.}
strings.1834001: {}{A simple Grenade used in the american civil war with a rather primitive contact fuze and stabilising fins. Make sure it hits even ground.}
strings.1840001: {}{One of the first widely adopted military automatic pistols. It's only real drawback was its high manufacturing cost due to its precisely machined toggle-lock system.}
strings.1840101: {}{Originally in .455 webley, the Mark VI can fire .45 ACP. Prominently used by the British in the first world war.}
strings.1840201: {}{One of the very few revolvers that can effectively be silenced due to its action and its special ammunition preventing gas leak at the cylinder gap.}
strings.1841001: {}{Third time's the charm, as they say.}
strings.1841101: {}{A rifled double Barrel over-under Shotgun. Should be used with slugs since the rifling will randomly scatter the shot all over the place.}
strings.1841201: {}{A not so popular weapon due to the cylinder gap spraying gas and lead into the shooter's wrist, but who cares about getting their arm chewed up when there are 5 shots in a row to be had?}
strings.1842001: {}{The Treeby uses a chain of chambers rather than a solid revolver type cylinder to achieve repeating firepower and was developed with point-defense in mind but never got past the prototype stage.}
strings.1842501: {}{One of the first popular and functional repeating rifles in widespread military use. Although its reloading process is a bit unhandy and the lever-action is not as smooth as the later winchesters, it was considered high-tech at its prime.}
strings.1843001: {}{Even though repeating arms were available for quite some time in the 19th century, armies are slow to embrace new technology, especially if it's still teething. Not much can go wrong with a simple single-shot rifle.}
strings.1845001: {}{The Maxim gun was arguably one of the earliest and most succesfull machine guns. This is one of the earliest models, chambered for .45-70 Government.}
strings.1845501: {}{Hopefully it doesn't explode in your face.}
strings.1850001: {}{The punch dagger is a spike which fits onto the back of the hand to increase the penetration of a punch.}
strings.1850501: {}{A high-quality combat knife, the Stallona is from SharpWit, Inc. The edge of this blade is guaranteed sharp for over a decade of use!}
strings.1851001: {}{This all-American, hardwood, baseball bat will knock anything right out of the park.}
strings.1852001: {}{A spear with a serrated blade to cut through armor.}
strings.1854001: {}{Also known as the Mills bomb, this is a british made fragmentation grenade, widely used in world war one and beyond.}
strings.1860001: {}{One of the most famous handguns, in service since the early 20th century.}
strings.1860101: {}{A simple revolver, powerful but takes a lot of precious time to reload.}
strings.1860501: {}{One of the earliest widely and effectively used submachine guns dating back to the first world war.}
strings.1861001: {}{What can go wrong with a John Browning design?}
strings.1862001: {}{This rifle was approved by the british military at the end of the great war but its order was cancelled as the war ended. It is a long and bulky weapon but its magazine holds 19 rounds.}
strings.1862501: {}{One of the most popular lever-action designs with millions of units produced, this John Browning design wont let you down.}
strings.1863001: {}{Argued by some to be the best bolt-action design due to its fast cock-on-closing mechanism, the Lee-Enfield has its place in history and in the wasteland.}
strings.1863501: {}{An early effective and quite influential gun, as elements of it were later copied in the German FG-42 and the M60 machine gun.}
strings.1863601: {}{The myth about this gun being one of the worst ever made is false. While the basic design is not perfect, it's notoriety comes from bad .30-06 conversions. This example however appears to be finely made and should work well.}
strings.1863701: {}{The Madsen is one of the few very early light machine guns that managed to see a lot of effective use in both the world wars and beyond. Designed in Denmark around the turn of the 20th century, it was in production into the 1950's in various calibers.}
strings.1864001: {}{The first type of anti-material rifle, introduced in 1918 to fight the first tanks of the battlefield. It was quickly made obsolete afterwards.}
strings.1864501: {}{During the first world war, all forces tried to lessen the weight of their maxim-type of heavy machine gun and the Bergmann was no exception. The lighter n.A. variant filled the gap between stationary heavy machine gun and bolt-action rifle.}
strings.1865001: {}{As a lot of the machineguns of world war one, this is essentially a Maxim gun design. The updated version of 1915 tries to make the gun a bit lighter but it's unclear whether they really succeeded.}
strings.1865101: {}{This is a Japanese heavy machine gun, known by the Allies in WW2 as the 'Woodpecker' for its distinctly slow rate of fire. Its 6,5mm cartridge is a bit underpowered for its role and it was redesigned in the 1930's for a stronger 7,7mm cartridge, but it's incredibly accurate.}
strings.1866001: {}{The most advanced portable flamethrower of WWI, the Wechselapparat Modell 1917 (interchangeable apparatusmodel 1917), so called because its fuel tank and other components could be quickly exchanged.}
strings.1866101: {}{It is a nice backpack of fuel and death.}
strings.1866201: {}{The "Kleinflammenwerfer" or "small flamethrower" was the first man-portable flamethrower used by the Germans in the first world war.}
strings.1866301: {}{Housing the fuel for the main arm attached by a hose, ready to explode.}
strings.1866501: {}{The Blanch-Chevailler grenade discharger is an experimental stand-alone grenade launcher during the first world war. It's not quite as comfortable to fire as you would hope but you can't be picky now.}
strings.1867001: {}{The Goddard rocket launcher, named after eclectic rocket scientist Robert. H. Goddard, was successfully tested just five days before WW1 ended and thus never saw any production.}
strings.1870001: {}{Gloves with extensible built in claws in the back of the hand.}
strings.1871001: {}{A very solid and heavy piece of metal, specially designed to exert leverage. Or pound heads.}
strings.1872001: {}{A spear that has been prepared with poison.}
strings.1874001: {}{Famously used by the Germans in both world wars, the stick grenade had the advantage of longer range due to leverage, but the handle made them heavier and awkward to carry.}
strings.1875001: {}{Side effects include nausea, vomiting, fatigue, dizziness, dry mouth, headache, itching, muscle aches, pains and death. Use responsibly}
strings.1880001: {}{In the 1930's, it was time to replace the very obsolete 1895 Nagant revolver with a modern semi-automatic pistol.}
strings.1880101: {}{A powerful and accurate revolver, popular with law enforcement and military.}
strings.1880201: {}{The PPK, which in German stands for Police-Pistol-Criminal, was commonly used by various German government forces since the 1930's, as its compact design lend itself to concealed carry. Its real claim to fame however have been its movie appearances.}
strings.1880301: {}{Initially designed as a signal pistol, the Sturmpistole was adapted to fire grenades based on the Stielhandgranate 24, as well as other grenades, as a somewhat improvised anti-tank weapon.}
strings.1880501: {}{A cheaper and simpler submachine gun than the PPD it replaces, having made it possible for the Soviet army to equip whole companies with these.}
strings.1880601: {}{A submachine gun that was designed to be as cheap and quick as possible to make to help the war effort. Silenced versions like these one's were in use with british special forces.}
strings.1880701: {}{the KP31 is considered to be one of the best sub-machine guns of world war II, with a high capacity and a high rate of fire that remains controllable due to its high weight.}
strings.1881001: {}{A commercial winchester model 1897 shotgun with a shortened barrel, bayonet lug and a perforated heatshield makes for a perfect trench fighting weapon.}
strings.1881501: {}{This weapon set the bar for post world war II rifle design as it was the first one to combine the right kind of features into an economically feasable package that could be mass produced.}
strings.1882001: {}{The small and handy M2 carbine was developed as a weapon for second-line troops who needed something bigger than just a handgun but also not quite a full sized rifle. It remained popular both inside and outside of military service.}
strings.1882101: {}{Largely forgotten battle rifle, used in early nineteen-thirties. It was a gas-operated self-loading gun. It has gone out of use quickly, due to maintenance problems and complicated operating mechanism.}
strings.1882201: {}{This is an early German prototype semi-auto rifle using a rotary five-round magazine. Not much is known about this rifle's history other than its patents which date decades earlier.}
strings.1882301: {}{The SVT was supposed to be the next service rifle of the soviet army after the Mosin-Nagant, but world war II got in the way of mass deployment. It proved somewhat unreliable and inaccurate however, and was quickly replaced by more modern developments like the SKS and AK-47 after the war.}
strings.1882401: {}{Called 'the first assault rifle' by some, the Fedorov was designed just before WWI and saw some limited use. While quite capable on paper, it was too expensive and fragile for mass use.}
strings.1882501: {}{Probably the only original, winchester-made American "levergun" to see formal widespread service with the Russian military in world war I, where it was quite well liked.}
strings.1882601: {}{In the 1920's, a couple hundred semi-automatic Remington Model 8's were redesigned and offered as a modern and fancy package to police forces in the US, where they saw some use. This one is chambered in .300 Savage.}
strings.1883001: {}{The primary service rifle of the German Wehrmacht of world war II with millions of units produced, lost and captured. Even hundreds of years later they still turn up in conflict zones and that bolt still runs as smoothly as ever.}
strings.1883101: {}{As one of the most produced service rifles of the world, the Mosin-Nagant needs no introduction. This particular one seems to have a somewhat sticky bolt, but that's probably just coincidence.}
strings.1883501: {}{Known as the "Record Player" due to its unusual flat 47-round pan magazine mounted on top of the rifle, the DP-28 was a relatively lightweight, although somewhat fragile gun.}
strings.1883601: {}{This was a somewhat unsuccessful Swedish light machine gun, initially designed to replace or at least supplant the BAR's in use by the Swedes in the 1930's. It suffered from reliability issues and was given to the Finns as military aid during the Winter War.}
strings.1883701: {}{This is a czech LMG, a direct precursor to the zb-26 which lead to the Bren Gun. Instead of the top-feed box magazine, this version uses a container with a loose 50-round belt adapted from the Schwarzlose machinegun and is somewhat cumbersome to reload which explains its further development.}
strings.1883801: {}{The Lahti-Saloranta M/26 was the main Finnish light machine gun during world war II, until large quantities of DP-28's were captured, which the troops preferred to use over the low-capacity LS/26. It was, however, renowned for its accuracy.}
strings.1884001: {}{While most nations developed larger caliber anti-tank rifles in the interwar period, the Germans instead bet on speed, using a tungsten 8mm bullet with a humongous powder charge. As was the fate of all anti-tank rifles however, it was obsolete in its role by the time it was introduced.}
strings.1884501: {}{After the first world war, Russia was in need of a lightweigt, domestically produced machine gun. The Maxim-Tokarev was essentially a lightened, modified maxim gun and was soon replaced by new designs.}
strings.1885001: {}{This is a modernized version of the Gorjunow SG-43 heavy machinegun. It was developed during world war II to replace the obsolete Russian copies of the water cooled maxim-guns still in service, offering more firepower at less weight.}
strings.1886001: {}{A very heavy and bulky flamethrower that only has a very limited capacity and expends what little fuel it has very quickly.}
strings.1886101: {}{Big load for the bunker hiding, bush proning commies.}
strings.1886501: {}{Similar to the Blanch-Chevailler and the Sturmpistole, and indeed many other improvised projects of the early and mid 20th century, the Sturmkampfgewehr was developed as a stand-alone platform based on a Kar98 rifle to launch grenades.}
strings.1886601: {}{After the age of the anti-tank rifle was over, the power of the Panzerbüchse 39 was repurposed to propel grenades over long distances, using a grenade cup muzzle device and blanks.}
strings.1887001: {}{A smaller version of the more well known Panzerfaust 60, the Faustpatrone is supposed to have an effective range of 30 meters and is to be disposed of after use.}
strings.1890001: {}{Sappers are lead filled gloves which are ideal for beating the crap out of opponents.}
strings.1890501: {}{A machete is a large, long, sharp knife, designed to hack through vegetation. They make handy melee weapons too.}
strings.1890601: {}{This blade is best used for peeling potatoes, cutting cucumbers, eviscerating humans, skinning rats. Your all round best friend.}
strings.1891501: {}{A sturdy axe. Time to chop some firewood.}
strings.1892001: {}{A spear that has multiple sharp stingers instead of a single spearhead. Bounces off armor but shreds flesh like butter.}
strings.1894001: {}{A standard stick grenade with an extra metal jacket added, designed to increase fragmentation and thus wounding potential.}
strings.1895001: {}{A crude but effective smoke grenade. Takes its time to produce a thick layer of smoke.}
strings.1895101: {}{While the molotov cocktail is usually known as an improvised weapon consisting of fuel in a glass battle with a burning rag, the Finns, who came up with it during the winter war, perfected and mass-produced it. Instead of a rag, it uses two all-weather matches, and the contents are a mix of different chemicals to provide optimal burning.}
strings.1895501: {}{This mortar-like grenade launcher was a stopgap anti-tank weapon, used to lob incendiaries at enemy tanks to incapacitate their crew. As most anti-tank weapons, it was quickly rendered obsolete in its intended role.}
strings.1900001: {}{This revolver is fitted with a speedloader to compensate one of the gun's main drawbacks.}
strings.1900101: {}{A Yugoslavian upgrade of the Tokarev TT-33, featuring an extended magazine and decreased weight.}
strings.1900501: {}{A popularly known sub-machine gun due to its presence in countless action movies.}
strings.1900601: {}{An UZI witha silencer attached, perfect for undetected assassinations.}
strings.1901001: {}{Just like the M1897, the Model 12 was also used in military service well into the 60's and 70's after production ended and the US Army expended their stock.}
strings.1901501: {}{Even after hundreds of years, these rifles are still found everywhere on the planet. Cheap, reliable and powerful at close range.}
strings.1902001: {}{This SKS has seen better days but that's no problem, it doesn't seem to mind the abuse.}
strings.1902101: {}{This automatic battle rifle was produced in Nazi Germany during World War II. It was considered to be one of the most advanced weapon designs. Due to this, the gun is hard to maintain.}
strings.1902501: {}{Infamous for its "bling" sound when the last round was fired and the magazine automatically ejected.}
strings.1902601: {}{While the SVT-40 is an improved SVT-38, it was not possible to improve its abysmal accuracy. While a mass rollout of sniper versions was planned, the project was soon scrapped, and production rifles were not even fitted with the necessary scope rails. The couple hundred snipers that were produced were used in the winter war, however.}
strings.1903001: {}{Standard Kar98k rifles that were found to be exceptionally accurate during factory testing were converted into sniper variants with a special scope mount added that required precise machining. Other changes include removal of the bayonet lug and a different buttplate.}
strings.1903101: {}{As was customary in many militaries around the world, well performing individual standard rifles were selected to be converted into sniper versions, with various scopes seeing use during world war II. The Mosin sniper version stayed in service until the introduction of the Dragunov SVD in 1963.}
strings.1903501: {}{The Browning Automatic Rifle, one of the earliest light machine gun designs in active service for decades, it suffered from its high weight and overall bulkyness.}
strings.1903601: {}{Known as a British light machine gun with a very long service life, the Bren is actually of czech origin, it's name being a portmanteau of Brno and Enfield. Due its long and wide service history, it is available in all kinds of calibers. This one is an export version in .30-06 Springfield.}
strings.1903701: {}{Realizing that the full power 7,62x54mmR cartridge used in the DP-28 was overpowered for many applications in the red army, designers went to work to use the new 7,62x39mm to develop a much lighter machine gun, that would introduce many modern features for a 1940's gun.}
strings.1904001: {}{Like all other nations, the Soviets also had their take on a soon-to-be obsolete anti-tank rifle at the beginning of world war II. Fires a humongous 1000grains projectile.}
strings.1904201: {}{Known as Finlands elephant gun, the lahti is a 20mm anti-tank rifle that was also used to great effect in a counter-sniping role, after more modern russian tanks rendered it obsolete in its initial role. It comes with both a bipod and a set of skies for soft ground and snow, as well as a lot of weight and recoil.}
strings.1904501: {}{One of the best machineguns of its time, a quality design hampered only by its costly production. Relatively unique for a belt-fed machinegun, it features a crescent trigger that allows single shots.}
strings.1904601: {}{The Stinger was an ad-hoc improvisation by marines in the pacific theather of WWII, taking the aircraft version of the Browning M1919 and adding parts from BARs and M1 Carbines to make it fit for ground use. As an aircraft machine gun, its fire rate is triple that of the infantry version, making it much less controllable.}
strings.1904701: {}{The most feared firearm in World War II, the MG42 has an astonishing rate of fire of up to 1500 rounds per minute. While this particular gun looks more like an MG 3 with its new buttstock and grip, you still convince yourself that you're actually holding the 42.}
strings.1904801: {}{Not to be confused with the similarly named L-34 Sampo, the L-41 was an experimental belt-fed general-purpose-style machinegun, that was succesfully trialed and fielded in very small numbers, but ultimately not developed further. After shelving the L-41 to unsuccessfully try to convert the MG42 to 7,62x54R, the Finnish military decided against GPMG's in general, until finally adopting the PKM in 1990.}
strings.1905001: {}{This is one of the earliest succesfull machinegun with a long and storied service history all across the world. Though mostly used in vehicles, it does still fit on the old lightweight M2 tripod.}
strings.1905501: {}{A Flambe 450 model flamethrower, varmiter variation. Fires a short spray of extremely hot, flamable liquid. Requires specialized fuel to work properly.}
strings.1907001: {}{The Bazooka was an antitank rocket launcher used by the American troops in world war II where it was effective enough to quickly be reverse-engineered by the German side and introduced as the infamous "Panzerschreck".}
strings.1907101: {}{Unlike a rocket launcher which uses a fin stabilized projectile, the M18 acts more like an artillery piece. Even though most of the propellant gases are used to counter recoil, it still achieves much higher velocities than contemporary grenade- or rocket launchers.}
strings.1910001: {}{An actually issued item in the pacific theater of world war II, this glove looks like a normal glove, except for the .357 caliber firing mechanism on the back of the right hand.}
strings.1912001: {}{A diamond tipped spear which offers great penetration.}
strings.1912501: {}{A Farmer's Best Friend model cattle prod from Wattz Electronics. Uses small energy cells for power.}
strings.1914001: {}{This is a bunch of stick grenades cobbled together to be used as a makeshift satchel charge. These were regularly used to help assault fortifications in WWII.}
strings.1915001: {}{A grenade which is filled with highly flammable materials, burning with extremely high temperatures after ignition.}
strings.1915101: {}{This smoke grenade contains a mixture of potassium chlorate, lactose and black dye, which upon ignition releases a thick, visually impenetrable smoke screen. Even though the grenade casing remain intact after use, due to the exothermic reaction it can be scalding hot for several minutes after the smoke has cleared. Use responsibly, and remember that only you can prevent forest fires!}
strings.1920001: {}{An ancient Desert Eagle pistol, chambered .357 Magnum. Interest in late 20th century films made this one of the most popular handguns of all times.}
strings.1920101: {}{The Mateba is an automatic revolver which means that the recoil force of the cartridge rotates the cylinder and not the shooter. Together with its low bore axis, it results in a very accurate and smoothly shooting gun.}
strings.1920201: {}{Throwing big bullets around before it was cool, the Wildey was developed years before the Desert Eagle came out, yet never reached the same level of recognition. This version comes with a longer barrel and a scope mount and is chambered for .475 Wildey Magnum.}
strings.1920501: {}{In the 60's, this was one of the coolest guns to have. The baseline for 9mm submachine guns.}
strings.1920601: {}{An MP5 derivative that has a built-in suppressor. Widely used by special operations teams back in the day.}
strings.1920701: {}{A submachine gun produced in the 1960s. It's base model quickly went out of use, due to the expensive ammo that the weapon shoots.}
strings.1921001: {}{Famous pump-action shotgun, popular with law enforcement.}
strings.1921101: {}{With millions of guns sold, the M1100 ushered in the age of reliable gas operated auto-loading shotguns.}
strings.1921201: {}{This shotgun is a modification of the Model 1100, adding full-auto capability while otherwise being identical. It was used in very small numbers in the Vietnam war by special forces, where it was renowned for its destructive power but failed to remain reliable in the harsh conditions of Vietnam.}
strings.1921501: {}{Called the AR15 on the civilian market, its inherent accuracy, low weight and low recoil made it the favorite of many militaries and civilians alike.}
strings.1921601: {}{The Galil was an assault rifle developed in Israel, based on the Finnish Valmet rk.62 which is commonly appreciated as the 'highest quality' AK-type rifle. In fact, early Galils were produced with machinery bought from Finland. This is the short-barreled carbine version.}
strings.1922001: {}{This battle rifle was supposed to replace four other weapons in use with the US Army at the time, the M1 Garand, M1 Carbine, M3A1 Grease gun and the BAR. However, the weight and the powerful caliber rendered it impossible to replace all of them and the rifle was in time replaced by the M16.}
strings.1922501: {}{Upgraded Sniper version of the M1 Garand, used in the Korea war. Still as rugged and effective as its predecessor.}
strings.1923001: {}{A very popular hunting rifle, also served as the basis for the M24 and M40 weapon systems.}
strings.1923101: {}{The silent sniper system was a modified winchester M70 sniper rifle, in use with the marine corps at the time, converted to a subsonic .458 magnum round. It performed well during tests but was unpractical in the conditions in vietnam, where especially the weight of the integrated supressor was a problem.}
strings.1923501: {}{A light machine gun design, developed alongside the AK-47 in the 1950's. Most of its parts are based on the AK-47 and are interchangable, to some extent.}
strings.1923601: {}{A promising and innovative machinegun at the time which only saw very small scale use in world war 2 with american elite troops, liked by the troops for being much more lighter and handier than the bulky BAR.}
strings.1923701: {}{This was Finlands standard light machine gun, introduced in the early 1960's. It sports a very high rate of fire but is accurate and controllable in the right hands.}
strings.1924501: {}{This relatively light machine gun was prized by militaries around for world for its high rate of fire. This reliable, battlefield-proven design was used on vehicles and for squad level fire-support.}
strings.1924601: {}{The Swiss started looking for a new GPMG in the middle of WWII and were borrowing heavily from the successfull MG42. After adopting the MG 51 themselves, the SIG MG 710 was developed and marketed for export in NATO caliber, but did not see many buyers, probably due its high quality and following pricetag.}
strings.1925001: {}{The Microgun was a scaled down M134 Minigun developed in the early 1960's for use in 5,56x45mm NATO. Although intended for mounted use on vehicle, a handful of portable versions were produced.}
strings.1926001: {}{A cold war era Flamethrower that stores fuel in three separate small tanks, discharging one tank fully with each pull of the trigger.}
strings.1926101: {}{These tanks can hold a total of about 10 liters of liquid Fuel. Don't let it go to waste.}
strings.1926501: {}{The M79 was designed around the time of the Vietnam war to supply the grenadier with more firepower than the rifle-grenades had to offerwhile keeping it lighter and more flexible than a mortar.}
strings.1927001: {}{The Light Anti-Armor Weapon is a single-use unguided rocket launcher developed in the late 1960's to replace the Bazooka. The unit is not reusable and should be discarded after firing.}
strings.1927601: {}{Also known as a Special Operations Forces Laser Acquisition Marker is a US military Laser designator. Designed for specific range-finding and locating of critical targets for destruction.}
strings.1930001: {}{A glove fitted with a small gun barrel that holds a single shotgun shell. The gun is triggered upon impact with an enemy jaw line.}
strings.1930501: {}{An improvised ripper, not quite as easy to use as it takes some time to spin up, but still very effective when used properly.}
strings.1931501: {}{A large hammer with big handle. Very popular with the muscular crowd.}
strings.1932001: {}{Someone went out of their way to create the weapon of their dreams. Not recommended for use in melee combat.}
strings.1935001: {}{These weapons contain sulfur mustard mixed with a thickener, which gives it a tar-like viscosity.}
strings.1935101: {}{Also known as the Flashbang, this grenade utilizes a loud bang and a bright flash to temporarily incapacitate enemies.}
strings.1935501: {}{The XM174 was a prototype automatic grenade launcher that was developed during the vietnam war to give the troops more firepower. It used the same 40x46mm grenade as the M79 instead of the higher powered 40x53mm used in future automatic grenade launchers in order to keep the weight man-portable, but its lack of range and still incredible bulk had it soon relegated to rear guard duties in small numbers, with focus put on the Mk 19.}
strings.1940001: {}{The only automatic handgun design that fires the .30 carbine round.}
strings.1940101: {}{A pretty unique revolver that fires the centuries-old .45-70govt. cartridge originally used in the late 19th century.}
strings.1940201: {}{A small scale grenade launcher, firing a single 40mm grenade. Should be handled with care.}
strings.1940301: {}{The USP is produced by Heckler & Koch and features a unique recoil system that allows the pistol to take high pressure, high performance rounds without excessive wear or discomfort to the shooter. It was used by many special forces and law enforcement agencies worldwide.}
strings.1940501: {}{Known for its unique helical high capacity magazine, this example is actually chambered for the 7,62x25mm Tokarev round which is much faster than the 9x18 Makarov usually used but also limits the magazine capacity.}
strings.1940601: {}{The silenced version of the PP-19, using subsonic 9mm ammunition.}
strings.1941001: {}{The SPAS-12 is a dual mode shotgun, allowing semi-automatic operation as well as pump action, if needed.}
strings.1941501: {}{Modernized version of the AKS-74 assault rifle.}
strings.1941601: {}{Designed as a modular weapons platform with machine gun, rifle and carbine configurations built around a single, interchangeable receiver, it is a great weapon for someone who can take of it but was not deemed optimal for the average grunt in the army and did not see adoption.}
strings.1942001: {}{German-made assault rifle comparable to the FN FAL. It makes up for the loss of power with increased accuracy and sniping capabilities.}
strings.1942101: {}{The FN FAL, short for Fusil Automatique Leger (light automatic rifle), is a selective-fire battle rifle produced by the Belgian arms manufacturer Fabrique Nationale de Herstal (FN). This rifle has been more widely used by armed forces than any other rifle in history.}
strings.1942501: {}{Famous sniper rifle of Russian design, firing the hard-hitting 7,62x54mmR 7N14 round.}
strings.1943001: {}{If you need to take a very long range shot but don't want to haul a 20 pound anti material rifle around, then this is your weapon of choice.}
strings.1943501: {}{As the 5,45mm cartridge was introduced, the RPK was also updated to easen the logistics. The relatively low rate of fire and high weight of the gun for its cartridge make for very controllable bursts.}
strings.1943601: {}{The light machine gun variant of the Stoner 63 saw limited use in Vietnam with the Marines and the Navy Seals, but the whole Stoner weapon system never received much recognition beyond that. It was rejected mostly due to maintenance issues and its overall complexity rather than combat effectiveness.}
strings.1943701: {}{As the HK21 family of machineguns are a straight development from the G3 battle rifle, they retain many features usually not found on machineguns, like selective fire capabilities, firing from a closed bolt and accepting belts as well as magazines. This particular model could be described as a battle rifle, designated marksman rifle and light machine gun at once.}
strings.1944001: {}{A German family of highly accurate and modern sniper rifles. This is the biggest of them, chambered in the mighty .50 BMG.}
strings.1944501: {}{Polish general purpose machine gun based off the russian PKM but firing 7,62x51mm NATO ammunition.}
strings.1945001: {}{A Rockwell CZ53 Personal Minigun. A multi-barreled chaingun firing 5.3mm ammunition at over 60,000 RPM.}
strings.1945501: {}{A Flambe 450 model flamethrower, varmiter variation. Fires a short spray of extremely hot, flamable liquid. Requires specialized fuel to work properly. This model has been modified to fire a hotter mixture which causes greater combustibility.}
strings.1946501: {}{This is a pump action grenade launcher that was produced in small numbers at the CHina Lake Naval Weapons Center specifically for the Navy SEALs. It is relatively lightweight and compact for the firepower it offers.}
strings.1947001: {}{Produced by the Soviets in the 1960's, this rocket launcher as probably seen every major and minor battlefield since the Vietnam War, owing to its simplicity and mass production.}
strings.1947101: {}{This is a Russian-produced disposable rocket launcher with a thermobaric warhead, designed for use against soft targets.}
strings.1947501: {}{Energy weapon that throws out a burst of negatively charged ions, repelling whomever is hit. Reliably pushes your opponent with offset force.}
strings.1947601: {}{A Wattz 1000 Laser Pistol. Civilian model, so the wattage is lower than military or police versions. Uses small energy cells.}
strings.1947701: {}{Glock 86 Plasma Pistol. Designed by the Gaston Glock AI. Shoots a small bolt of superheated plasma. Powered by a small energy cell.}
strings.1948501: {}{A Wattz 2000 Laser Rifle. Uses micro fusion cells for more powerful lasers, and an extended barrel for additional range.}
strings.1948601: {}{The Unittech Sonic Rifle 2000k is a energy weapon that uses a combination of ultrasonic and subsonic sound waves to do damage and debilitate a target.}
strings.1949501: {}{The high impact concussive sonic energy was stabilized by a containment sphere within the cannon until impact against a target, at which point it broke up to create an omnidirectional blast.}
strings.1950001: {}{Gloves with pistons built in it. More than doubles the force behind a punch.}
strings.1950501: {}{A short finely crafted knife. The tip seems to be designed to pierce armor.}
strings.1951501: {}{A Micro Sledgehammer, manufactured according to the Brotherhood of Steel's plans, using the finest weapons technology available. Includes a kinetic energy storage device to increase knock-back.}
strings.1952001: {}{The piston attached to the spear causes an immense knockback upon hitting a target. It only comes into effect when the spear is thrown since the trigger mechanism requires a certain force to work.}
strings.1954001: {}{A generic fragmentation grenade. Contains a small amount of high explosives, the container itself forming most of the damaging fragments. Uses a timed fuse.}
strings.1954501: {}{A magnetically sealed plasma delivery unit, with detonating explosives. Creates a blast of superheated plasma on contact.}
strings.1954601: {}{Built upon gravitron technology, this device produce a powerful but harmless force when detonated. It also seems to have an option for uncontrolled explosion.}
strings.1955501: {}{An automatic grenade launcher of russian design. Capable of firing a burst of high velocity explosive rounds.}
strings.1960001: {}{An ancient Desert Eagle pistol, in .50 Action Express. Interest in late 20th century films made this one of the most popular handguns of all times.}
strings.1960101: {}{Claimed as the most powerful production revolver in the world by the time it was introduced, this gun features ultimate power among all handguns.}
strings.1960201: {}{You suspect this Bringham needler pistol was once used for scientific field studies. It uses small hard-plastic hypodermic darts as ammo.}
strings.1960301: {}{This pistol uses a proprietary powerful and fast cartridge to produce a flat trajectory that allows easy hits and armor penetration even at intermediate ranges. The gun comes with a counterweight underneath the muzzle and is surprisingly soft-shooting for its power.}
strings.1960501: {}{An update of the cold war era Skorpion vz. 61, the Evo III retains the compactness and high rate of fire of its predecessor.}
strings.1960601: {}{The silenced version of the Skorpion Evo III, using subsonic ammunition.}
strings.1961001: {}{A Winchester City-Killer 12-gauge combat shotgun, bullpup variant. In excellent condition, it has the optional DesertWarfare environmental sealant modification for extra reliability.}
strings.1961101: {}{The Jackhammer, despite its name, is an easy to control shotgun, even when fired on full automatic. The popular bullpup design, which places the magazine behind the trigger, makes the weapon well balanced & easy to control.}
strings.1961201: {}{This pump-action shotgun is unique in that it not only has two tube magazines, but also two barrels, allowing for twice the fun, and twice the reload time.}
strings.1961501: {}{The AEK-971 main design point is its improved AK-style recoil system, limiting travel distance of reciprocating parts, resulting in a higher, yet more controllable rate of fire.}
strings.1961601: {}{The commando version of the very much respected swiss SG-550 line of rifles.}
strings.1962001: {}{While some people question the viability of selective fire capabilities on a full power rifle in general, the slow rate of fire and buffer system should alleviate some of those concerns.}
strings.1962501: {}{Famous sniper rifle of Russian design, firing the hard-hitting 7,62x54mmR 7N14 round. This model is a modernized version, a bullpup design with a suppressor and selective fire capabilities.}
strings.1963001: {}{The Accuracy International AX338 is an evolution from the Arctic Warfare series and is designed for long, high-powered super magnum cartridges like the .338 Lapua Magnum.}
strings.1963501: {}{U.S. military version of the FN Minimi. Its high rate of fire allows for very good suppressive fire capabilities.}
strings.1963601: {}{As the final evolution of the Stoner system, this Light Assault Machine Gun uses a constant recoil system and a very lightweight construction to create a rifle-sized package with the firepower of a machine gun.}
strings.1964001: {}{A British anti-material rifle renowned for its accuracy even over extremely long ranges.}
strings.1964501: {}{High power cartridge, high rate of fire and long range make this a devastating machinegun at medium to long ranges.}
strings.1964601: {}{Mass produced russian made machine gun, firing the powerful 7,62x54mmR round.}
strings.1965001: {}{Rockwell designed the Avenger as the replacement for their aging CZ53 Personal Minigun. The Avenger's design improvements include a new ammunition feed system that enables the user to fire thousands of rounds without the need to reload as long as the rounds are properly handled.}
strings.1965501: {}{A flamethrower with the unique capability of firing a long ranged shot of condensed napalm, resembling an incendiary grenade.}
strings.1966501: {}{Similar to the M79 and China Lake Grenade Launcher, the Milkor was designed to greatly enhance the firepower of individual fire teams. The Milkor is able to use the 40mm medium pressure grenades, giving it more range than the standard underbarrel grenade launchers.}
strings.1966601: {}{Taking inspiration from various anti-material rifles and grenade launchers, the LG5 fires high velocity grenades with a focus on precision, supposedly able to reliable land grenades in windows from hundreds of meters away.}
strings.1967001: {}{A Rockwell BigBazooka rocket launcher. With the deluxe 3 lb. trigger. Fires AP or Explosive Rockets.}
strings.1967501: {}{This Glock 86 Plasma Pistol has had its magnetic housing chamber realigned to reduce the drain on its energy cell. Its efficiency has doubled, allowing it to fire more shots before the battery is expended.}
strings.1967601: {}{The YK32 is an electrical pulse weapon that was developed by the Yuma Flats Energy Consortium. Though powerful, the YK32 was never considered a practical weapon due to its inefficient energy usage and bulky design.}
strings.1967701: {}{Without the sun's rays to charge this weapon's cpacitors this gun can't light a match. However, in full daylight, the experimental photo-electric cells that power the Scorcher allow it to turn almost anything into a crispy critter.}
strings.1967801: {}{This Wattz 1000 laser pistol has been upgraded with a magnetic field targeting system that tightens the laser emission, giving this pistol extra penetrating power.}
strings.1968001: {}{The little brother of the Rad Rifle, this smg was even less of a commercial success. It is based on the principles of a plasma weapon, but doesn't quite reach the temperatures needed to "melt" the projectiles into plasma. However, during early experimentation the engineers noticed that they could exploit the fact and turned it into a hybrid weapon, shooting conventional rounds in burst fire mode but shooting plasma bolts in single fire.}
strings.1968101: {}{A hybrid weapon in the sense that it shoots convential flechette ammunition, but infuses them with an electrical charge, first. The built in power source has a charging mechanism activated by holding the trigger for a second before releasing it, giving single shots much greater energy.}
strings.1968501: {}{This Wattz 2000 laser rifle has had its recharging system upgraded and a special recycling chip installed that reduces the drain on the micro fusion cell by 50%.}
strings.1969001: {}{A Winchester Model P94 Plasma Rifle. An industrial-grade energy weapon, firing superheated bolts of plasma down a superconducting barrel. Powered by Micro Fusion Cells.}
strings.1969101: {}{Though its name says otherwise, this rifle does not actually irradiate its targets and just works as any plasma rifle does. The producers just thought the alliteration might help promotion of the weapon. Unfortunately, most people were afraid to expose themselves to the radiation this gun seemed to create so it done diddly not sell well and was only ever produced in small numbers.}
strings.1969201: {}{This weapon fires a small bolt of plasma which is infused with eletrical energy, being the main source of the damage.}
strings.1969301: {}{In the early 21st century, West Tek company was tasked to create an energy weapon capable of neutralising multiple targets on the battlefield within seconds. It was decided to create something big, formidable, and preferably hitting the target with high-voltage. Experiment 1 was something of a success, although it wasn't approved by the military because of its cost.}
strings.1969401: {}{Bulky, industrial plasma casters manufactured by Winchester Arms were once popular. While they performed admirably, they were expensive and required specialized training to use. Later developments by the United States Army would lead to a more compact design that was cheaper to produce and easier to train for, suitable for urban warfare.}
strings.1969501: {}{An H&K L30 Gatling Laser. Designed specifically for military use, these were in the prototype stage at the beginning of the War. Multiple barrels allow longer firing before overheating. Powered by Micro Fusion Cells.}
strings.1969601: {}{The Phase-Induced Plasma Cannon, PIP Z85, uses a combination of plasma formation and ohmic plasma-ignition methods to maximize effectiveness. This technique uses particle-charged magnetic field beams induced into existing plasma, thereby multiplying the energy level of the plasma by 3.3 EV.}
strings.1969701: {}{A high tech form of sniper rifle, the Particle Accelerator has extreme range, but can not be used at short range as it has to have a certain distance for the particles to be magnetically channeled, focused, and projected.}
strings.1970001: {}{A "Big Frigger" Power Fist from BeatCo. Considered by many to be the ultimate weapon to use in unarmed combat. Others are just scared. Powered by small energy cells.}
strings.1970501: {}{A Ripper(tm) vibroblade. Powered by a small energy cell, the chainblade rips and tears into it's target.}
strings.1971001: {}{A Farmer's Best Friend model cattle prod from Wattz Electronics. This model has been upgraded to increase the electrical discharge.}
strings.1971501: {}{A Super Sledgehammer, manufactured by the Brotherhood of Steel, using the finest weapons technology available. Includes a kinetic energy storage device, to increase knockback.}
strings.1972001: {}{One of the most high-tech poles of wood to be found. This spear's tip features an intricate device that emitts plasma upon contact. If thrown, the bater is fully discharged delivering massive plasma damage.}
strings.1974001: {}{While this grenade has more explosive power than a frag grenade, it has a smaller effective kill radius when it comes to anti-personnel use. It does however create a bigger shockwave, able to knock people over.}
strings.1974501: {}{An electromagnetic pulse grenade, generating an intense magnetic field on detonation. Effect on biological creatures is greatly reduced.}
strings.1980001: {}{Praised for its range and stopping power, the PPK12 Gauss Pistol is of German design. The pistol uses an electromagnetic field to propel rounds at tremendous speed and punch through almost any armor.}
strings.1980501: {}{The Fabrique Nationale P90 was just coming into use at the time of the war. The weapon's bullpup layout, and compact design, make it easy to control. The durable P90 is prized for its reliability, and high firepower in a ruggedly-compact package.}
strings.1981001: {}{The CAWS, short for Close Assault Weapons System, shotgun is a useful tool for close-range combat. The bullpup layout gives the weapon a short, easily handleable, length while still retaining enough barrel length for its high velocity shells.}
strings.1981501: {}{This gun revolutionized assault weapon design. The weapon fires a caseless cartridge consisting of a block of propellant with a bullet buried inside. The resultant weight and space savings allow this weapon to have a very high magazine capacity. Upgraded version, fitted with a scope.}
strings.1982001: {}{Developed as part of the NGSW program to find a replacement for the venerable M16 Rifle, the MCX Spear was chosen in 2022. It features very high pressure ammunition specifically for the purpose of penetrating modern body armor at long ranges.}
strings.1983001: {}{The M72 rifle is of German design. It uses an electromagnetic field to propel rounds at tremendous speed... and pierce almost any obstacle. Its range, accuracy and stopping power is almost unparalleled.}
strings.1983501: {}{An Israeli-made light machine gun, it is somewhat unique in the sense that it is a belt-fed machine gun firing the high power 7,62x51mm cartridge, yet retains a light enough recoil and a general low weight to be used as a squad automatic weapon, Much like the M249, all while also sporting single shot capability.}
strings.1984001: {}{The ultimate refinement of the sniper's art. Although somewhat finicky and prone to jamming if not kept scrupulously clean, the big weapon's stopping power more than makes up for its extra maintenance requirements.}
strings.1985001: {}{The German Rheinmetal AG company created the ultimate minigun. The Vindicator throws over 90,000 caseless shells per minute down its six carbon-polymer barrels. As the pinnacle of Teutonic engineering skill, it is the ultimate hand-held weapon.}
strings.1987501: {}{A strange gun of obviously alien origin. Looks like it can support small energy cells, however.}
strings.1988501: {}{The YK42B is an electrical pulse weapon that was developed by the Yuma Flats Energy Consortium. It is considered a far superior weapon to the YK32 pistol, having a greater charge capacity and range.}
strings.1988601: {}{A modified Winchester P94 plasma rifle. The plasma bolt chamber has been hotwired to accelerate the bolt formation process.}
strings.1991501: {}{It has a glowing red blade formed of electrical energy. Capable of cutting down pretty much anything due to it's incredible heat. This axe is the pinnacle of engineering when it comes to taking care of your garden.}
strings.2000101: {}{This general-purpose universal one-use repair kit is a wastelander's third best friend. Find a flat surface, lay down your gear, and save yourself the embarrassment of wardrobe malfunctions.}
strings.2000401: {}{Explosive breaching can be the fastest method, though it is also the most dangerous, to both the breachers and the room occupants.}
strings.2000501: {}{An injection of adrenaline can be used to revive unconcious soldiers.}
strings.2000701: {}{A shaped charge is an explosive charge shaped to focus the effect of the explosive's energy.}
strings.2000801: {}{It is an improvised explosive device, a tightly sealed section of pipe filled with an explosive material. The containment provided by the pipe means that simple low explosives can be used to produce a relatively large explosion, and the fragmentation of the pipe itself creates potentially lethal shrapnel.}
strings.2000901: {}{A little of engineering skill and any door will dead stuck for some time minutes. Any idea of tactical application?}
strings.2001001: {}{This note is legal tender for all debts, public and private under the authority of the Lawyer Agency.}
strings.2001201: {}{A wooden merit that represents your hard work.}
strings.2001301: {}{The fruit of your toil. Hail, Comrade!}
strings.2001401: {}{Quit while you�re ahead. All the best gamblers do.}
strings.2001601: {}{Life is hard without a credit card to get by.}
strings.2002601: {}{Also known as a Special Operations Forces Laser Acquisition Marker is a US military Laser designator. Designed for specific range-finding and locating of critical targets for destruction.}
strings.2002701: {}{A curiously dark garment, resembling the darkest of night skies. A raiment nearly as black as your soul.}
strings.2002801: {}{A set of robes made from glorious pink satin. Someone with a sense of fashion would not be caught dead in this.}
strings.2002901: {}{A set of robes made from resistant mutated fibers. Someone with a sense of fashion has dyed them blue.}
strings.2003001: {}{A set of robes made from resistant mutated fibers. Someone with a sense of fashion has dyed them green.}
strings.2003101: {}{A set of robes made from resistant mutated fibers. Someone without a sense of fashion has dyed them yellow. Gross.}
strings.2003201: {}{A set of robes made from resistant mutated fibers. Someone with a sense of fashion has dyed them orange.}
strings.2003301: {}{An elegant purple robe reinforced with various mutated fibers and leathers representing the Boreal Church. They are custom made by the Clerics and will not be easily modified or painted.}
strings.2003401: {}{A Robe belonging to a Kleaner, as white as it gets in the wasteland.}
strings.2040001: {}{"Now, I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds"}
strings.2041101: {}{A RobCo Stealth Boy 3001 personal stealth device. Generates a modulating field that transmits the reflected light from one side of an object to the other.}
strings.2041201: {}{A RobCo Stealth Boy 3001 personal stealth device. Generates a modulating field that transmits the reflected light from one side of an object to the other.}
strings.2041301: {}{A RobCo Stealth Boy 3001 personal stealth device. Generates a modulating field that transmits the reflected light from one side of an object to the other.}
strings.2041401: {}{A RobCo Stealth Boy 3001 personal stealth device. Generates a modulating field that transmits the reflected light from one side of an object to the other.}
strings.2041501: {}{A RobCo Stealth Boy 3001 personal stealth device. Generates a modulating field that transmits the reflected light from one side of an object to the other.}
strings.2041601: {}{A RobCo Stealth Boy 3001 personal stealth device. Generates a modulating field that transmits the reflected light from one side of an object to the other.}
strings.2041701: {}{A simple camo netting thrown over your regular Armor to help in stealthy operations.}
strings.2041801: {}{A simple camo netting thrown over your regular Armor to help in stealthy operations.}
strings.2041901: {}{The Jammerpack transmits a white noise signal which cuts off communications. The protection jamming radius can reach up to 25 hexes in standard environment.}
strings.2042001: {}{Simple metallic caltrops. Thrown into an area, they are sure to be a nuisance to enemies!}
strings.2500001: {}{Heavy pieces of rock containing traces of Iron.}
strings.2500101: {}{The energy source of choice for the working man.}
strings.2500201: {}{Heavy pieces of rock containing various minerals.}
strings.2500301: {}{These rare earths could be used in high grade metals and electronics if they are processed correctly.}
strings.2500501: {}{Rather than throwing it, you can use this for simple construction.}
strings.2502601: {}{A thick string of tissue gathered from certain plants.}
strings.2505001: {}{A bar of iron, freshly cast, ready to use.}
strings.2505101: {}{In this form, the minerals are ready for further processing.}
strings.2505201: {}{A box with a black powder. Not necessarily blackpowder.}
strings.2505301: {}{A jar of chemical components for various appliances.}
strings.2505401: {}{A piece of leather ready to be used for armor, or the finest cowboy boots.}
strings.2505601: {}{Small quantities of other minerals and metals are often required to make high grade steel.}
strings.2505701: {}{A handful of polymer pellets, a high-tech material used in countless military applications.}
strings.2505801: {}{A fine piece of leather from the pelt of a fire gecko. Still hot to the touch.}
strings.2505901: {}{A synthetic fiber commonly used in military protective gear.}
strings.2506001: {}{High quality steel with all impurities removed.}
strings.2506201: {}{A bunch of expensive computer parts, valuable to every craftsman.}
strings.2506301: {}{A chunk of processed uranium. Luckily, with today's background radiation, it's nothing special to worry about.}
strings.2506401: {}{The scraps of a pigrat pelt, if you can call it that. Smells nice.}
strings.2506501: {}{A skinned molerat, ready for further processing. And boy, does it need it.}
strings.2506601: {}{Rough leather, made from the scraps of pigrats and molerats. Inferior to the wasteland-standard brahmin and gecko leather.}
strings.2507501: {}{Random pieces of low quality metal, plastics and other stuff.}
strings.2510001: {}{A set of plans for a piece of equipment of some kind.}
strings.2510101: {}{A set of plans for a piece of equipment of some kind.}
strings.2510201: {}{A set of plans for a piece of equipment of some kind, it's clear it has undergone some heavy decay.}
strings.2510301: {}{A set of plans for a piece of equipment of some kind, it's clear it has undergone some heavy decay.}
strings.2510401: {}{A set of plans for a piece of equipment of some kind.}
strings.2510501: {}{A set of plans for a device of some kind.}
strings.2512501: {}{A workbench. Yep, your standard old, run of the mill, workbench. Looks nice sitting there, too.}
strings.2512601: {}{A workbench. Yep, an improved, modern workbench. Looks nice sitting there, too.}
strings.2512801: {}{A workbench. Yep, your standard old, run of the mill, workbench. Looks nice sitting there, too.}
strings.2512901: {}{A workbench. Yep, an improved, modern workbench. Looks nice sitting there, too.}
strings.2513101: {}{A workbench. Yep, your standard old, run of the mill, workbench. Looks nice sitting there, too.}
strings.2513201: {}{A workbench. Yep, an improved, modern, electronically assisted workbench. Looks nice sitting there, too.}
strings.2517501: {}{The barrel contains burning paper and other flamable refuse.}
strings.2518101: {}{This looks like a wood-burning alcohol still.}
strings.2518201: {}{It's got a good set of heat going, ready for some brahmin shanks.}
strings.2520001: {}{A small portion of a mutated rodent's body. A cheap and commonly found food that is said to strengthen your heart after being cooked in open fire.}
strings.2520101: {}{Dog meat is a common dietary component in the waste. Tasty, with high nutritional value, a popular choice among wastelanders.}
strings.2520201: {}{A popular choice in the wasteland, flesh meat has a good taste and high nutritional value.}
strings.2520301: {}{A popular meat in the wasteland. Nutritious and hardly contaminated.}
strings.2520401: {}{Cut from overgrown lizards, a common meat avaliable in the waste. Great for kebabs.}
strings.2520501: {}{This meat is glowing from radiactivity, said to be very enjoyable delicate meat for ghouls and mutants.}
strings.2520601: {}{This is a piece of brahmin meat.}
strings.2520701: {}{A heavy chunk of deathclaw meat. Since deathclaw are considered one of the most dangerous creatures, their meat is highly valued by veteran wastelanders who are willing to buy it for fairly high prices.}
strings.2520801: {}{A part of an alien tentacle. Tough and fibrous. Braised long enough it might just become fork tender.}
strings.2520901: {}{A huge slab of meat from a molerat emperor. This meat is highly sought for by the trappers and big game hunters all around.}
strings.2521001: {}{A large chunk of chitin off of an ant queen. The chitin is still seeping potent formic acid.}
strings.2521101: {}{The tail of a king radscorpion. It is said that the poison on the tip of the tail is one of the strongest known naturally occuring toxins.}
strings.2521201: {}{Meat from an alpha deathclaw. Not particularly different in taste or nutrition value from regular deathclaw meat, but it is highly valued as a trophy.}
strings.2521301: {}{A very sturdy metal cup filled with a tea made from Xander root.}
strings.2521401: {}{A very sturdy metal cup filled with a tea made from Broc flowers.}
strings.2522501: {}{2 small skewered tushkanos, grilled and seasoned with salt and chili pepper. The cheapest hot meal available in the waste. Wrapped in thick brown paper to prevent the fat from dripping.}
strings.2522601: {}{A small hot meal of grilled dog chops mixed with garlic, peppers and mushrooms. Served in an old tin box. A cheap alternative to the more popular brahmin beef.}
strings.2522701: {}{2 slices of fat and greasy bacon made from mutated pigs commonly known as pigrat. Wrapped in thick brown paper to prevent the fat from dripping.}
strings.2522801: {}{A small portion of molerat meat, grilled and seasoned with salt and mixed with peppers. A popular warm meal among wastelanders. Wrapped in brown paper.}
strings.2522901: {}{Some charred gecko meat and vegetables on a cooking stick.}
strings.2523001: {}{Standard 12oz steak spiced and cooked to medium rare; the only acceptable way to have steak.}
strings.2523101: {}{A portion of grilled deathclaw meat, served with mushrooms and spices. An expensive meal, eaten most commonly by veteran Stalkers to celebrate accomplishment of difficult missions.}
strings.2523201: {}{Mmmh, tastes just like chicken. Or is it more like fish?}
strings.2523301: {}{Those taste nothing like when they were raw.}
strings.2523401: {}{Who knew that mixing crushed seeds with water and then heating it up, would result in such a tasty treat?!.}
strings.2523501: {}{Do not question how or where it was made, all that matters is that it is tasty.}
strings.2525101: {}{This mining tool comes with a better grip and is made of better materials.}
strings.2525201: {}{You want to mine the ores fast and long? This is just the tool you want.}
strings.2525401: {}{A better axe for the job of cutting down the trees.}
strings.2525501: {}{Jack Lumber used this tool to deal with evil trees.}
strings.2525701: {}{Breaks less and has a better handle. With it you can harvest many more plants.}
strings.2525801: {}{Just like a potato peeler, a 'must have' if you are planning on harvesting some plants.}
strings.2531001: {}{Carrying this field repair kit with you allows you to repair any armors in the field without a workbench. It may break after some uses}
strings.2531101: {}{Carrying this field repair kit with you allows you to repair any small guns in the field without a workbench. It may break after some uses}
strings.2531201: {}{Carrying this field repair kit with you allows you to repair any big guns in the field without a workbench. It may break after some uses}
strings.2531301: {}{Carrying this field repair kit with you allows you to repair any energy weapons in the field without a workbench. It may break after some uses}
strings.2531401: {}{Carrying this field repair kit with you allows you to repair any melee weapons in the field without a workbench. It may break after some uses}
strings.2545001: {}{Contains a lot of round small sticky brown balls. They have no smell or taste. The label states that this is plant food. How very strange.}

strings.4000010: {}{There is a shiny, very expensive looking |0xFFFF0000 necklace |0xFF00FF00 right at the edge of the watch tower. I don't know how I could possibly fail this mission. The jewel is but an arm's length away, and it beckons me to reach out for it...}
strings.4000100: {}{There's absolutely nothing suspicious at all with this quest.}
strings.4000300: {}{Quest failed: The precious was just within my reach as I took a wrong step and fell off the tower. The fall was particularly nasty, it could easily have killed me. As it was, I got away with some bruises and a broken leg. Somebody has set up us the necklace!}
strings.4001010: {}{After laughing at me for falling down the ladder, Hawk Eye wants to "get to business". If I do what he asks, he has promised to teach me the |0xFFFFFF00 Awareness |0xFF00FF00 perk.}
strings.4001100: {}{I am to find a |0xFFFF0000 Scout Handbook |0xFF00FF00 and bring it back to |0xFFFFFF00 Hawk Eye |0xFF00FF00.}
strings.4001101: {}{Finding a Scout Handbook was apparently just a test to make sure I was up for the REAL challenge. Now Hawk Eye wants me to kill a |0xFFFF0000 deathclaw |0xFF00FF00 . He better not be pulling my leg on this one...}
strings.4001200: {}{I'm surprised Hawk Eye didn't want me to go after a pack of Super Mutants after killing that Deathclaw. He actually kept his word and taught me the Awareness perk.}
strings.4002010: {}{There are still things that Hawk Eye can teach me. In exchange for a |0xFF00FF00 special sneak weapon |0xFF00FF00 , he will show me how to run and sneak at the same time.}
strings.4002200: {}{I gave Hawk Eye a sneak weapon and he taught me the Silent Running perk. I also got some caps for the weapon.}
strings.4003010: {}{If I can prove to Bruce that I'm "man enough", he'll teach me how to evaluate the strength of others just by looking at them.}
strings.4003100: {}{Bruce wants me to |0xFFFF0000 kill |0xFF00FF00 10 |0xFFFF0000 Golden Geckos |0xFF00FF00 to prove myself worthy of his knowledge.}
